loans.name: Yolmi Lorena

texts.es:
Yolmy es una bella mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza y relajación en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de equipo electrocurador, alta frecuencia, vaporizador, faja térmica y surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Yolmy is a beautiful 20 year old woman.  She is single and was raised with some very good customs.  Since junior high she has developed a great passion and joy for all things related to beauty.  

She began her work by taking courses and training, until one day she decided to take a chance and go looking for her own customers, starting a beauty and relaxation salon in her home.  

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase equipment such as a high frequency electric dryer, a vaporizer, thermal bandages, and a variety of products to sell in order to complement her services, such as hand creme, gel, hair products, hair dye and and nail polish.  

This loan is very important for Yolmy because it will allow her to consolidate her business with all the necessary items in order to operate and offer any services that her clients request.  

Her dream is that her business will grow and she will have many customers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as a high frequency electric dryer, a vaporizer, thermal bandages, and a variety of product to sell in order to complement her services, such as hand creme, gel, hair products, hair dye and and nail polish.

loans.name: Gustavo Alberto

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es felizmente casado, con su pareja tuvo 2 hijos ya ambos mayores de edad y con familia, tiene un café- bar donde ofrece la gran cantidad de 11 empleos ya que su negocio es muy reconocido y frecuentado por el ambiente, por la variedad en bebidas, por la rapidez y agilidad de servicio esas quizás son las claves de su éxito y le ayuda mucho tener varios empleados.

Aparte de las bebidas, música, juegos de mesa, también tiene billar, ofrece campeonatos, concursos, realiza bingos bailables en verdad es muy recursivo y sabe cómo atraer personas.
 
Su consigna es mantenerse en el mercado, tener sus clientes siempre satisfechos, lograr clientes nuevos y que estos vuelvan y algún día dejar el negocio a sus hijos.

Gustavo quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en bebidas alcohólicas y cervezas para su negocio. Como ha sido unos meses difíciles no tiene mucho capital para surtir y ya que de él depende 11 empleos quiere asegurar primero el capital para pagar.

Ayuda a este empresario tan sobresaliente que cuenta con 11 empleos, a superar un momento de adversidad sin necesidad de recurrir a la terminación del contrato de algunos de sus pupilos.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 55, is happily married.  He and his life partner have two children.  The children are both married with families.  Gustavo has a café-bar where he offers the great number of eleven jobs.  His business is very well-known.  It is very busy because of the atmosphere, the variety of drinks, and the quick and agile service.  Perhaps these are the keys to his success.  It helps him a great deal to have several employees.

Besides the drinks, music, and table games, he also has billiards.  He offers championships and tournaments.  He does dancing bingo.  He is truly very resourceful, and he knows how to attract people.

His proposition is to maintain himself in the market, to always have satisfied customers, to get new customers and that they return, and to one day leave the business to his children.

Gustavo wants to request a loan to buy alcoholic beverages and beer for his business.  As there have been some difficult months, he does not have a lot of capital to use to stock up.  Eleven employees depend upon him, and he wants to first assure he has the capital to pay them.

Help this outstanding businessman who has 11 employees to overcome a moment of adversity without having to resort to terminating the contracts of some of his proteges.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages and beer for his business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three sons and one daughter, and all of her children study. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 18 years. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for resale, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Shaheen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing sales business

loans.name: Melaflor

texts.en:
Melaflor earns a living by engaging in a tuba (coconut) wine vending business. She buys and sells coconut wine to the locals in her community. Aside from that, she is also a dealer of frozen goods like lumpia (spring roll) and soriso (sausage). She is a 29-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is two. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like tuba (coconut) wine and frozen goods. The loan will help Melaflor purchase more tuba and a variety of frozen goods to be sold. This will enable her to provide more stocks to her respective customers, and to encourage them to purchase. Thus, her income will increase and she will be better able to handle her finances. She would also be able to provide her children with good food. 

Melaflor would like to expand her both businesses to become successful and to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies like tuba (coconut) wine and frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a solar-powered water pump for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for husband's rickshaw repairing workshop.

loans.name: Walter De Jesus

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Walter es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, ella siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.
 
El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de 2 vacas lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Working in the field is one of the most difficult jobs today that takes great effort to succeed. Walter is a man who has never given up in spite of weather or circumstances that could impede his progress. He is always keeping an eye out for resources with which to support his family. He gets up early in the morning to work various farms, completing his jobs. He alternates his farm work with selling the milk he gets from his own cows.

He wishes to increase his working capital to guarantee his business continuing, therefore he seeks a loan to invest in buying 2 milk cows, which will give his business a push forward.

loans.use: to buy 2 milk cows to give his business a good push forward.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 56 years old with two children and is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Carolina and her husband operate their wholesale-retail feed and poultry supply business. Their business is their only source of income, so they work double hard by working from 7 am up to 6 pm. and also delivering the feed to their customers.

Now Carolina has two helpers in her store and also has added other items like hen coops, drinkers, egg trays and other poultry equipment.

Carolina is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy sacks of feed and poultry supply to be delivered and sold to customers. 

Carolina wanted to expand her business more in the future to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed and poultry supply to be delivered and sold to customers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Her name is Flora, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juddy, a welder. The couple works hard to  provide for their daily personal household needs. 

Flora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, instant noodles, chips, coffee soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and good return on her investment for it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Flora hopes grow her business and have a bigger store someday. She hopes that God will bless them with a peaceful and abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aurelia, en su humilde hogar, intenta ganarse la vida con la venta de golosinas, dulces, obleas, entre otros. Con estos alimentos intenta salir adelante día a día.

Vive en con uno de sus tres hijos en su casa el cual la apoya en su pequeño negocio.

Con esta actividad ha sobrevivido durante 10 años, y a pesar de los pocos ingresos y lo difícil de su vida, nunca deja su alegría y sonrisa.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido de confites, dulces, insumos para sus obleas, entre otros.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de abastecerse y tener su negocio un poco mas consolidado.
texts.en:
Aurelia, in her humble home, intends to make a living selling candies, sweets, and obleas (wafers with fillings), among others. With these foods, she intends to come out ahead day to day.

She lives with one of her three children in her home, who supports her in her small business.

With this activity, she has survived for 10 years, and despite the small income and difficulties in her life, she never abandons her happiness or smile.

She is requesting economic support to purchase an assortment of candies, sweets, and supplies for her obleas, among others.

This loan will give her the opportunity to stock up and have her business be a little more established.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of candies, sweets, and supplies for her obleas, among others.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
For eleven long years, Tirso has been working as a sewer in a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. His basic responsibility is sewing clothes and maintaining the sewing machines. He’s married to Alma, also a sewer, and they are blessed with two children. The couple’s combined minimum wage cannot usually suffice to meet their growing financial needs, especially since they are paying a monthly amortization for their house. They were able to acquire a low-cost housing unit in high hopes of having their own house. Even if the house is bare, which means it badly needs improvement and furnishings, they manage to live in it. 

Due to their growing basic family needs, house repair and improvement lag behind other priorities. Much as they want to improve it, they don’t want to snatch the budget from their basic needs and children’s education. Also, they no longer want to be enslaved to usurious money-lenders who charge very high interest rates and retain their automated teller machine (ATM) card as loan collateral. It is a blessing that Tirso became a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* where he got the information that there are other options for taking a loan. With your kind help he can now have the opportunity to improve their house, a home to their happy family.  

Tirso dreams for their children to finish their education, as it is their most valued inheritance. With a college degree, they have a better chance of lifting themselves from poverty. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and work. 

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. 

**CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs and improvement

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been in the business of tailoring for many years to support her family. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Mumtaz hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking woman who runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like soap, sugar, salt, rice, and others. She lives in Masindi, Uganda with her two children, both of whom are able to attend school. She started the business so as to cater to the needs of her family. 

She desires to buy land and build a house for her children. Competition and price fluctuations are the challenges she usually complains of.

She is requesting a loan to buy more general merchandise like sugar, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise like sugar, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Unidos Por La Fuerza Y La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith Jenifer es una joven de 22 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "Unidos por la fuerza y la Esperanza" donde todos los integrantes trabajan y tienen negocio independiente.
A su corta edad Edith Jenifer cuenta con un negocio de servicio de computadoras Internet y recargas virtuales para lineas de celulares en su domicilio sus principales clientes son estudiantes, vecinos y trabajadores donde se dedica al cien por ciento para poder obtener un bienestar económico en su hogar, unas de sus metas es seguir creciendo como empresaria implementando mas su negocio y darle a sus clientes el mejor servicio con mayor rapidez.
la Sra. Edith Jenifer utilizara el préstamo para comprar e implementar mas su negocio como en la compra de audifonos para las computadoras, teclados y mantener saldo para que realice las recargas virtuales de sus clientes. ella se siente entusiasmada  y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brinda y la confianza que depositan en ella y en todo su grupo "Unidos por la Fuerza y la Esperanza".

Este grupo está compuesto por 5 mujeres y 2 hombres. Uno de los hombres está en la primera fila de la foto con una remera blanca y el otro está parado a la izquierda con una remera negra y pelo enrulado.
texts.en:
Edith Jenifer is a young woman, age 22.  She is part of the group, “Unidos por la Fuerza y la Esperanza” [United by Strength and Hope], in which all the members work and have independent businesses.

At her young age, Edith Jenifer has a business in her residence, offering computer internet service and virtual recharges for cell phones.  Her principal customers are students, neighbors, and workers.  She is 100% dedicated to being able to obtain economic well-being in her home. One of her goals is to continue growing as a businesswoman by better equipping her business and giving her customers the best service more quickly. 

Edith Jenifer will use the loan to better equip her business by purchasing items such as computer headphones and keyboards, and to maintain a balance of virtual recharges so that she can provide them to her customers. She feels elated and grateful for the support given to her, and for the trust placed in her and in her entire group, “Unidos por la Fuerza y la Esperanza”.

There are 5 women and 2 men in this group. One of the men is in the first row with a white t-shirt and the other one is standing on the left with a black t-shirt and long curly hair.

loans.use: to purchase headphones and keyboards, and to maintain a balance of cell phone recharges.

loans.name: Joaquin Guillermo

texts.es:
Jose es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
El tiene un cultivo de flores el cual trabaja todos los días en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.
Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Jose is a veteran with much experience in the fields. He is humble and simple, has a gift with people and enough energy to grow anything. He has a flower plantation which he works daily in the municipality of El Carmen De Viboral. Thanks to his years of experience and his father's teachings since he was a boy he has the ability to work and to advise other farmers from the area who need help with their production.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, banana seeds and pesticides. In this way he will inject capital into his business and improve his crops in a significant manner. He is facing his greatest difficulty which is the changing climate which affects his crops. He has great faith in his business and great hopes in the supportive people who support the working Colombian farmer as does the Interactuar Corporation. Support this humble farmer with a loan so he can progress with his lands.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, banana seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Imagine going about mundane daily tasks at your small business when, all of a sudden, the assistant of an incredibly famous celebrity walks in and places a large order. This is how Justin felt when he realized that one of his customers was musical artist Nicki Minaj’s assistant. It was probably, he says, one of his proudest moments as a business owner. 

After years of working for a wireless internet company, Justin started BK Bottles in January of 2013 because he wanted to earn a living by working for himself. BK Bottles is a spirits store, which he owns and operates by himself, and which allows him to support his mother and himself.

Justin hopes to continue to improve his store and make a net positive impact on his community. However, his greatest difficulty has been keeping the store stocked with the necessary amount of products to meet customer demand. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods for his store

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
Jesibel is a 38-year-old married woman with two dependents, ages 8 and 4 years old respectively. She engages in selling fresh fish to the locals in her place. Her husband is a fisherman. To be able to support her family, she is the one who sells the catch of her husband. She has been engaged in this kind of business for six years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, floaters, and rope. These tools would really improve the family's catch, and she would be able to sell more fish. Thus, it will boost her income and she will be able to pay her obligations.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable, and to also help improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, floaters, and rope.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a 36-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for seven years and also earns an income from an E-Loading station.

 
Cecilia has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new one for  PHP 60000  to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, spices, eggs, etc. 

Cecillia aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Luis Rodrigo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 28 años, él vive junto a su esposa de 30 años y sus 5 hijos en una casa ubicada en el barrio el Rosario de la parroquia Chaltura de Atuntaqui desde hace un año, de la cual pagan arriendo mensualmente.  Luis tiene una hija con capacidades especiales por lo que cobran en bono de 50 dólares por su hija y aparte 50 dólares del bono de desarrollo humano, con esto se ayudan para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Luis se dedica a la crianza cuyes y gallinas desde hace algunos años, esta actividad la realizo como iniciativa propia con la ayuda de la mujer y también con el apoyo de la familia y hoy en día tiene su criadero de cuyes de la cuales también realiza comercio en diferentes ferias de la provincia, la actividad le ayuda para poder solventarse en todas las necesidades que necesite dentro de cada mes y también para dar todo el bienestar para la familia además él tiene unos terrenos con siembra de tomates que es otro ingreso que le ayuda en el hogar. Con el crédito va comprar más animales para seguir realizando más comercio y seguir ayudando en el hogar y sacar adelante a la familia.
Agradece a KIVA por todo el apoyo que le brindan con el capital para seguir fortaleciendo cada día el negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old.  He has lived together with his wife, 30, and their five children in a rented home located in the Rosario neighborhood in the parish of Chaltura de Atuntaqui for a year.  Luis has a daughter with special needs, so he is provided 50 dollars for his daughter and another 50 dollars from human development.  These help meet their household expenses.  

Luis has worked raising guinea pigs and chickens for several years.  He does this work himself with the help of his wife and support of his family.  He currently breeds guinea pigs and sells them at different markets in the province.  This work helps to meet all of their needs each month.  He also has some land where he plants tomatoes, which provides another source of income to help his family's well-being.  

He wants to use this loan to purchase more animals to continue selling them.  He will continue helping his household and help his family move forward.  He is grateful to Kiva for all of the support they have provided.  The capital has strengthened his business every day.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to continue making sales and continue helping his household.

loans.name: Regalito De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REGALITO DE DIOS” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanesa es la Secretaria de Actas. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de edredones y frazadas
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanesa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de Frazadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frazadas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, , lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Regalito de Dios" will start the eighth cycle in 'Pro Mujer', as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani.  It is comprised of 8 members and is overseen by a board of directors where Vanesa is the secretary of records. 

The businesses of the association members are varied and include: clothing sales, food sales, local grocery store,and  sales of comforters and blankets.

The loans they receive benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, including member Vanesa.  She joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining after the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She has a business selling blankets and she learned this business some years ago under her own initiative.

The loan she will take out now is for the increase in capital (buying blankets wholesale), which she will acquire from the large sellers in the city of El Alto,  and then later sell in her retail space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family economically.  She is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about 'Pro Mujer', she responds that she likes the payment meetings and the health areas that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy blankets at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a display case, hair dye, shampoo, and massages.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 52-year-old factory worker who is married to Ricardo, a 56-year-old driver with an irregular income. They live in Biñan, Laguna with their four children.  

Everyday, Editha travels to GMA, Cavite to work as a sewer in a garment factory. For 13 years now, she has done the edging, sewing of clothes and maintenance of sewing machines. She has, however, become worried about the growing financial demands in raising their children, particularly with regard to their educational needs.

For a quite a while, Editha has observed that there is an increasing demand for mineral and purified water in their community. She’s confident that she can efficiently manage that kind of business and fervently prays that with your help, she can start her own distribution business soon. As a member of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*, she won’t have any problem in repaying the loan because it will be deducted from her salary every payday.
 
It is Editha's dream that through such a business, her family will have additional income for their children’s higher education needs. For Editha and her husband, education is the most valued legacy that they can give to their children. She trusts in the Lord that their children will finish education through your kind help. 

Editha meets up regularly with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. 

**CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to have starting capital for mineral or purified water distribution

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis, de 36 años, está en un negocio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, negocio que empezó el afán de sostener a su hija y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

En el momento en que nació su hija, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de construcción para iniciar con una obra.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su hija y a su esposa brindándoles una mejor oportunidad de progreso a través de su trabajo.

Apoya a Luis con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old and has a construction and home remodeling business in the municipality of El Carmen De Viboral. He started the business with the desire to support his daughter and offer her a better quality of life. The moment his daughter was born he was motivated to work tirelessly and give her the best for her life and development. Now she is the joy of this hardworking man's life.

He is requesting this loan to buy construction tools to start a project. With this loan he will be able to support his daughter and his wife and give them a better opportunity to get ahead through his work. Support Luis with this loan so that he can continue with his business!

loans.use: to buy construction tools to start a project.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 48 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 8 and 20 years and they all go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 7 years.  Also her husband is a farmer.  With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Josue Tomas

texts.es: Josué de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 14 años cuenta con una pequeña panadería, negocio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Josué vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad en vivienda de su propiedad. Josué desea construir un muro frente a su vivienda, el cual le permita brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro que le permita proteger su vivienda de la delincuencia de la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Josué is a hard working 37 year old man. He has had a small bakery for the last 14 years with which he has been able to raise his family. Josué lives in his own home with his wife and their two children who are 14 and 16 years old. 

Josué would like to build a wall in front of his home which will give his family more security, which is why he has applied for a loan from FUSAI. He will use this loan to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a wall to protect his home from crime in the area where he lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a wall in front of his house

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Solana with her family. They are involved in rice farming as a source of income. In the farming business, they plant and harvest rice to sell. Juliet also pays laborers who helps in farming activities such as sowing, planting and harvesting rice. Juliet wanted to increase their crop production but had insufficient funds to sustain the crops. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for crop growth. In the future, Juliet hopes to maintain good yields use for educational expenses of her two children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for crop growth

loans.name: Heber Arley

texts.es:
Heber un hombre de 32 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivado y emocionado ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la Corporación Interactuar puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comestibles como golosinas y frituras, un sueño que le ha sido errado pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia no le desembolsaban el préstamo. 

Con el crédito solicitado comprara surtido de alimentos, una mesa de trabajo, entro otros. 

Este crédito será de suma importancia para Heber pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente y una oportunidad de progresar como empresario.
texts.en:
Heber is a 32 year old man who is very motivated and excited at the opportunity that has arisen in his life. Thanks to Interactuar Heber is able to apply for a loan to start his own business selling food such as sweets and fried foods. This is a dream that has not yet been realised as this is his first loan so he has not yet been granted the loan.

With the loan he has applied for Heber will buy a variety of food, a work table, and other items. This loan is extremely important to him because it represents the start of an independent life and an opportunity to progress as a business owner.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food, a work table and other items.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of 2 daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.  Nasreen  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.  Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 30-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of a daughter. Her husband has been running a general store for the past five years.  Her husband is the one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Ishrat's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g, rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all  these products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore Ishrat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also help him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.  Ishrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, zippers, buckles, etc. to sew bags.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 31 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional recycled materials for her business.

Mylen has been in this business for two years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials for her business

loans.name: La Bendición 2 Group

texts.es:
En uno de los barrios más tranquilos de Oaxaca siete personas decidieron consolidar un grupo que lleva por nombre La Bendición 2; pues para ellos la oportunidad del préstamo para beneficiar su actividad es una bendición. La comunidad es una zona productora de caña de azúcar y la cosecha emplea a más de 2000 jornaleros. 
   Los integrantes del grupo son: Maura quien vende servilletas; Roberta, fruta y verdura; Alma, dulces; Sabina, ropa; Elena, dulces; Ángel, dulces e Imelda, bolsas y carteras. 
   Ángel es un joven muy trabajador, recientemente se casó y en tres meses se convertirá en padre de una pequeña. Hace 2 meses decidió trabajar como ayudante de albañil pero ahora desea brindar lo mejor a su familia por ello junto con su esposa inició la venta de dulces y botanas. Los fines de semana colocan dos mesas, una para los dulces y la otra para las botanas como chicharrones que se preparan con mayonesa, pollo, jamón, queso, media crema, jitomate, aguacate y salsa. Lo que más consumen sus clientes son papas, paletas de hielo, hielitos de sabores frutales, refrescos y fruta de temporada. Mario llega a vender hasta 80 hielitos y 40 paletas en un día.
   Los préstamos otorgados anteriormente le han sido de utilidad ya que los ha invertido en otras actividades como la venta de tortillas y esta vez en dulces. “Las ganancias obtenidas y mi salario lo ahorraré para el parto de mi esposa, siempre procurare brindarle lo mejor a mi familia” son palabras de Ángel quien se encuentra muy emocionado. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en botanas, chicles, paletas y dulces pues sus clientes principales son los niños de la comunidad; quienes acuden contentos al ver la mesa repleta de productos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Ángel, en donde coloca la mesa con los dulces, él es el único hombre del grupo.
texts.en:
In one of the most tranquil neighbourhoods of Oaxaca, seven people decided to form a group that they named La Bendición 2 (The Blessing 2) since for them the opportunities and job benefits that the loan provides them with is a blessing. They live in a community that produces sugar cane and employs more than 2000 labourers at harvest time.  

The group members are: Maura, who sells serviettes; Roberta, fruit and vegetables; Alma, lollies; Sabina, clothes; Elena, lollies; Ángel, lollies and Imelda, bags and wallets. 

Ángel is a very hardworking young man. He recently married and in three months he will become the father of a little one. Two months ago he decided to work as a builder's assistant but now he wants to give his family the best so that is why, together with his wife, he began selling lollies and snacks. On the weekend he assembles two tables: one for sweets and the other for snacks such as crackling which he prepares with mayonnaise, chicken, ham, cheese, light cream, tomato, avocado and salsa. The snacks his customers eat most are chips, icy poles, fruity flavoured ice cream, soft drinks and seasonal fruit. Mario is able to sell up to 80 ice creams and 40 icy poles in a day. 

The previous loans he was granted have been useful as he has invested them in other areas such as tortillas and now lollies. “The profits I have made and the amount I saved from my salary will go towards my wife's birth. I always try to give my family the best" are the words of Ángel, who was overcome with emotion. This new loan will be used to buy snacks, chewing gum, icy poles and lollies since his main customers are kids from the neighbourhood who are happy to come and see his table filled with products.  

*This photo was taken in Ángel's house where they put all the lollies on the table. He is the only man in the group.

loans.use: to buy chips, chewing gum, icy poles and lollies

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.en:
Hudoydod is a bright guy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. He is single and lives with his parents. 

He is a student at an Industrial Institution. He wants to be educated and be a specialist in his major. His parents are proud and believe he would be a good specialist. He is an active student and well known among friends and course mates. 

He studies part time and the rest of his time he spends helping his parents. The income of their family is spent only for family needs such as food and clothing. They have no money to pay for education. 

Hudoydod appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 54 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Fely has been in this business for four years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Akeela

texts.en: Akeela is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Akeela has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 43 years old, married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

He practices farming, growing vegetables such as cabbage, kale and potatoes. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to boost vegetable production. This will enable him to gain more income to pay for his family's expenses, such as clothing.

Geofrey is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost vegetable production. This will enable him to gain more income to pay for his family's expenses, such as clothing.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 48-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband. Shamim is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring in order to run her household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to spend her earnings on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Jupiter

texts.en:
This is Jupiter, from Carmona, Cavite, who is currently employed at a garment factory in GMA, Cavite. He started there as Sampling Sewer who prepares the sample clothing that serve as basis for other sewers to duplicate and reproduce. He performed this task for three years, then he was promoted as Sample Line Leader due to his diligence and commitment to work. For a year now, he supervises some sewers, monitors the production of sample clothing and updates the inventory record.

Just recently he got married to Maricel, and their first child is on the way. He is quite excited for the arrival of their firstborn and he is preparing for his wife's delivery. Although he already has some savings but he still needs huge amount. As a single person before, he has this loving attitude of giving a large portion of his salary to his parents to help in their everyday needs. Only a meager portion was being left for his allowance and savings. This is very normal for Filipino families who are known to be so closely knit.

Jupiter consulted his co-fellowship members at CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative* regarding his impending need for his wife’s delivery. He was advised to avoid the usurious money-lending agencies that proliferate in their community and he was offered another option through Kiva. The entire cooperative is praying for your help and for the safe delivery of their child.

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. **CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's delivery of their first child

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 37 years old and is from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children ages seventeen and nineteen. For twelve years, he has been in the business of cutting lumber to sell using his chainsaw. He earns PHP5000 a month from this business. He is asking a loan of PHP15000 to buy coconut and mahogany lumber to cut and sell, thus giving a boost to his source of income. 

His profit will provide for his son, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy mahogany and coconut lumber

loans.name: Tresilda

texts.en:
Tresilda works hard to support her family. Tresilda is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Tresilda has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Tresilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es una bella joven de 21 años de edad que impulsada por su deseo de estudiar inicio con la venta de mercancía, pues en su hogar son humildes y no tenían para pagarle una educación universitaria, esta joven no se dejo caer por la situación y ahora con su negocio paga su matrícula, fotocopias y se costea sus pasajes.

Juliana vende productos para el cuidado del cuerpo, salud, mejora de hábitos alimenticios, su tarea es hacerle ver a los clientes los enormes beneficios que traen estos productos y cumple su tarea pues con una sonrisa en el rostro puede decir que se encuentra estudiando gracias a sus propios esfuerzos.

Juliana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía, tratamientos, productos de consumo, de cuido facial, de cuidado bocal, productos para rebajar de pesos, son los más vendidos y en ellos quiere realizar su inversión.
texts.en:
Juliana is a beautiful 21 year old who driven by her desire to study started to sell merchandise. Her home is very humble and there is no one to pay for her university education. She didn't let the situation get her down and now her business pays her tuition, photocopies and cost of transportation.

Juliana sells body and health care products improving eating habits. Her task is to make the clients understand the enormous benefits that these products have and she fulfills this task with a smile on her face that might be saying that I am studying thanks to my own effort.

Juliana wants to request a loan to buy merchandise, treatments, consumer products, facial treatments, oral care products and weight loss products. They are what she sells the most so she wants to invest in them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, treatments, consumer products, facial treatments and oral care products.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 56 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

Cerila has been in this business for 26 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en: Latifan is a 52-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children. Latifan  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Nooreen

texts.en: Noreen has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Now she has attained good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. This will enable her to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a 29-year-old smallholder farmer from Chamula, a Tzotzil community from the central Chiapas highlands. With the help of an NGO, a governmental program and FAO, he was able to stop working as a day laborer and begin to work in his own greenhouse where he produces vegetable seedlings to sell to local producers. The main seedlings planted are broccoli, cabbage, lettuce, and cauliflower.

Federico wants to buy seeds in order to use the whole capacity of the greenhouse and meet the demand for seedlings in the region, considering that the productive process of the horticulture farms begins during the coming months with the start of the rainy season. 

For seedling production, Federico uses an eco-friendly process using organic fertilizers such as bokashi, a compost made out of fermented organic matter. He says that his objective is to achieve sustainable management of the ecosystems in order to interrelate the conservation of natural resources with better production levels.

With this loan, Federico and his wife will be able to generate employment in the region, sell seedlings to local producers and increase their family earnings to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds to produce and sell vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en: Zubida has successfully built her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors and designs. This will enable her to increase her sales to more customers and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors and designs to increase her sales to more customers and to gain more profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for sewing hand bags with the help of her daughters.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old, married and a mother of three children, of whom two are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management. 

She is a mixed farmer practicing dairy farming and also grows vegetables like cabbage, kale, onions and tomatoes. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy dairy feeds so as to increase milk production to meet customers' demands.  With increased income, she will be able to pay for her children's school fees at ease. 

Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to increase milk production so as to meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en: Kishwer is a 55-year-old widowed woman doing a business for many years buying and selling animals. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is aged 45 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 19 year and they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been working in agriculture for many years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  Her husband assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good-quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Kosar has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which would ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en: Robeena is a 37-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián es un padre de familia que ahora tiene 55 años de edad, que se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el apoyo brindado pues gracias al crédito el logro comprar sus semillas de papa y cebolla, y gracias a Dios el obtuvo muy buena cosecha y con las ganancias que gano él pudo comprar un televisor para su hogar. Él ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas y abono químico para poder cultivar en esta nueva temporada.
El gran sueño de Julián es poder comprar un terreno para poder incrementar aún más su cultivo.
texts.en: Julián is a father of a family who is now 55 years old. He is extremely grateful for the support given him. Thanks to the loan he manged to buy potato and onion seeds. Thanks to God he had a good harvest and with the profit he bought a television for his house. He now wants to request another loan to be able to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer to plant in this new season. Julián's big dream is to be able to buy some land to increase his cultivation more.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron goods to weld into iron accessories to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Her name is Vilma, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a construction worker. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs.

Vilma operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also makes peanut butter to sell at her small store by her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items and pay for the ingredients of peanut butter she sells at a retail price. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance.

Vilma hopes to expand her retail business.  She prays for God to bless them with an abundant and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and ingredients to make her peanut butter which she sells at her small store.

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
SAKINA, who is in her late 30s, is married with two kids who are still in school.  She has been running a gengeduka for three years now. She works from 05am to 09pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be SAKINA's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the gengeduka stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items like oranges, mangoes, tomatoes, melon, pawpaws, bananas, etc. 

She dreams of making her business really big.

Sakina will share this loan with her loan group, Vipaji, which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items like oranges, mangoes, tomatoes, melon, pawpaws, bananas, etc

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is 73 years old, a widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Nerlita requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Nerlita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de 33 años, trabajó como asalariado por varios años y logró con el fruto de su trabajo ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero que invirtió en su sueño de prosperidad, su ferretería, anhelo que fue posible gracias a su esfuerzo, dedicación y  apoyo de sus padres quienes fueron piezas fundamentales en la estructura de su idea de negocio. Todos los días de la semana a partir de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., los constructores, transeúntes del sector, vecinos y amigos, pueden realizar sus compras de materiales para la construcción; cemento, arena, gravilla, tornillería, artículos eléctricos, pegamentos, tuberías y hasta pinturas. Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda por parte de sus clientes, William está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en surtido; Block prefabricados, arena y granzón.  William es padre un niño de 3 años de edad y desea continuar trabajando para ofrecerle bienestar a su hijo y familia. Su meta de negocio es ser líder en la zona donde se encuentra ubicada su ferretería.
texts.en:
William, 33 years old, worked as a salaried employee for many years. He earned the fruits of his labor by saving a good quantity of money, which he invested in his hardware store, his dream of prosperity. This dream was made possible thanks to his effort, dedication, and support from his parents, who have been essential parts of the structure of his business idea. 

Every day of the week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., the construction builders, passers-by in the industry, neighbors, and friends, can make purchases for construction materials; cement, sand, gravel, nuts and bolts, electrical items, glue, tubes, and paint. 

With the purpose of meeting his customers' demands, William is applying for his first credikiva funding from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in supplies; prefabricated blocks, sand, and chippings. 

William is a father of a 3 year old, and hopes to continue working in order to offer a well-being for his son and family.

His business goal is to be the leader of the area where his hardware shop is located.

loans.use: to invest in supplies; prefabricated blocks, sand and chippings

loans.name: Jessery

texts.en:
Jessery is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Jessery works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc.

Jessery has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jessery would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Masindi, Uganda, where she earns money from selling new clothes and running rental houses, in addition to mobile money that adds to her income. She used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She started her business to support her family. She works from a busy street where the general public can access her. She has hopes of educating her children to a university level. Seasonality is a challenge that affects her business. Stella is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 30-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Yasmeen makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. Then she will make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Yasmeen wishes to utilize part of her revenue to provide a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available to her customers

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is 51 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Manzooran’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Manzooran has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Manzooran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle so he can drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran is a 48-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Ameeran’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Ameeran has requested 55,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es casada vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lorena con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo  con los gastos de la casa, ella es comerciante desde hace cinco años, pero también es asesora financiera en una institución privada.
Lorena es una mujer muy emprendedora que ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo  para poder comprar un mototaxi y prestar servicios de trasporte y mejorar sus ingresos.
El gran sueño de Lorena es poder conseguir el crédito y poder realizar la compra.
texts.en:
Lorena, 34, is a married woman who lives together with her husband a the community of Sololá.
With the desire to earn an income and support her husband with the household expenses, for five years she has been a merchandiser, but she is also a financial consultant in a private institution.
Lorena is a very enterprising woman who now has the initiative to request a loan in order to be able to purchase a mototaxi, to offer transportation services, and to improve her income.
Lorena's big dream is to get the loan and be able to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Nelly requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

In the future, Nelly would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guadalupe Victoria se localiza dentro uno de los barrios más conocidos de Oaxaca, actualmente se integra por 10 personas. Todos son responsables, trabajadores, honestos y día con día dan lo mejor de sí para ofrecer lo mejor a su familia. El grupo está integrado por: Imelda quien vende comida; Georgina, abarrotes; Abelina, zapatos; Silvestra, antojitos típicos; Rosa, zapatos; Lucelly, ropa y abarrotes; Yesenia, cosméticos y refrescos; Yolzyn, zapatos y abarrotes; Víctor, bisutería y Mariano quien  maneja un taller de costura. 
   Doña Georgina está casada con el señor Roque desde hace 10 años, dos de sus tres hijas la hicieron abuela por lo que se siente muy contenta. Doña Geo, como todos la conocen, inició con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, sólo exhibía  la mercancía en una mesa, transcurrido el tiempo y con ayuda de las ganancias realizó modificaciones al espacio e introdujo dulces, refrescos, botanas y verdura. Hoy en día ocupa una cochera y coloca la mercancía en anaqueles metálicos y de plástico. A pesar de la competencia, Geo se ha logrado posicionar debido a que los clientes buscan precios accesibles, extenso surtido y un trato amable. “El crecimiento de una actividad debe ser, lento, preciso y conciso” comenta con seguridad.
   Tener su tienda en casa le hace sentir segura, después de las 7:00 pm despacha únicamente a través de una ventana del portón. Con parte de las ganancias apoya a su esposo con los gastos y también a sus hijas con la leche y los pañales de los bebés. 
   En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en leche, azúcar, galletas, arroz, sopa, frijol, maíz, aceite, queso, jamón, salchichas, botanas , refrescos, platos y vasos desechables. Doña Geo piensa de igual forma cambiar el piso de tierra de su casa por un piso firme de concreto. 
   El grupo Guadalupe Victoria agradece por los préstamos otorgados pues con ellos han incrementado el rendimiento de sus actividades.
*La fotografía se tomó en la tienda de doña Geo, ella es la única que usa lentes, los niños de la foto aparecen con sus respetivas mamás.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Victoria group is located in one of the most renowned areas of Oaxaca and is currently made up of 10 people. All of them are responsible, hard working, honest people who give their all every day for their families. The group is made up of Imelda, who sells food; Georgina, groceries; Abelina, shoes; Silvestra, traditional glasses; Rosa, shoes; Lucelly, clothing and groceries; Yesenia, cosmetics and soft drinks; Yolzyn, shoes and groceries; Víctor, jewellery and Mariano, who runs a sewing workshop.

Georgina has been married to Roque for 10 years. Two of her three daughters have made her a grandma which she is very happy about. Geo, as everyone knows her by, began a small grocery store where she just displayed her merchandise on a table. As time passed and helped by her earnings she modified her space and introduced lollies, soft drinks, snacks and vegetables. These days she occupies a shed where she displays her merchandise on metal and plastic shelves. In spite of the competition, Geo has been able to get ahead thanks to her customers who seek out her accessible prices, extensive range and friendly service. “The growth of a business should be slow, precise and concise", she remarked with certainty.

Having a store in her own home makes Geo feel safe. After 7pm she only makes sales through a window in the door. She uses part of her earnings to help her husband with the bills and her daughters with milk and nappies for the babies.
 
On this occasion she will use her loan to buy milk, sugar, biscuits, rice, soup, beans, corn, oil, cheese, ham, sausages, chips, soft drink and disposable plates and glasses. Geo is also thinking of replacing the dirt floor of her house with a firm cement floor.
The Guadalupe Victoria group give thanks for the loans that they have been granted because they have increased the profits they have made in their jobs. 

*This photograph was taken in Geo's store. She is the only one who is wearing glasses. The children in the photo appear with their respective mothers.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, biscuits, rice, soup, beans, corn, oil, cheese, ham, sausages, chips, soft drink and disposable plates and glasses

loans.name: Edilse María

texts.es: Edilse de 41 años, inicio su negocio motivada por su cónyuge quien le propuso invertir en una panadería puesto que él tenía experiencia en el campo, ella acepto muy entusiasta y se decidió a comprar los enseres, equipos y materias primas necesarias para empezar a producir. Hoy en día lleva dos años ofreciendo productos de excelente calidad; panes de diferentes clases, pudines para ocasiones especiales y pasabocas, los cuales son distribuidos desde su vivienda ubicada al sur de barranquilla, en donde sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector se ven tentados a disfrutar de los deliciosos productos de repostería que ella en compañía de su cónyuge elabora, aunque sus principales clientes son las tiendas de barrios aledaños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de materias primas como harina, mantequilla, grasa, huevos, bocadillos, arequipe, levadura y demás.  Esta inversión permite incrementar el surtido en su negocio y poder abastecer la demanda.  Ella es madre de dos hijas a quienes desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y por eso desea a futuro tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Edilse, 41, began her business motivated by her husband who proposed to her to invest in a bakery since he had experience in the field.  She accepted very enthusiastically and decided to purchase the equipment, the hardware and the raw materials necessary to start production. These days, she has been offering products of excellent quality for two years: breads of different types, puddings for special occasions, and snacks, which are distributed from her residence in the south of Barranguilla, where her neighbors and passersby through the sector find themselves tempted to enjoy the delicious confectionary products which she in the company of her husband make, though the principal customers are the shops in the nearby neighborhoods.
