Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing request she makes through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in the purchase of raw materials such as flour, butter, lard, eggs, snacks, caramel, yeast, and more.  This investment will allow her to increase the assortment in her business and be able to meet the demand. 
She is the mother of two daughters to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life and because of this she wishes to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, lard, eggs, snacks, caramel, yeast, and more.

loans.name: Doris Barbara

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Palmas se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en el campo de la construcción.
Doña Doris es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y zapatos por catálogos,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en los momentos que esta mas desocupada aunque prefiere las mañanas ya que a esa hora es más fresco, ella también  vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja  sus productos a crédito  y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 2 años con esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su  negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group "Las Palmas" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very much visited in every season of the year, for its gastronomy, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Doris lives in this place. She is 42 years old and is married. From this relationship they have three children, ages 16, 14, and 13, who are in school. Her husband works in the field of construction.

Doña Doris is a very hard-working woman who, in order to help her husband with the expenses that the household generates, works in commerce. She sells clothing and shoes by catalog. Her form of sales is door to door. She goes out in the moments when she is not busy, although she prefers the mornings, since at this hour it is cooler. She also sells in her house, where her best-known customers come. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for more than 2 years, and it has given her very good profits.

This loan is to purchase clothing and shoes. She has been in the loan group for 3 cycles, and she likes it because the loans help her in her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anabela

texts.es:
Anabela es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chuaxic.
Anabela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa trabaja en la agricultura desde hace un año.
Anabela esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abono químico y semillas para el cultivo de esta temporada, porque ella es una joven con ganas de superarse y sacar adelante a su familia.
Anabela sueña con poder comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Anabela is a 20-year old young woman.  She lives with her parents in a Chuaxic community.
Anabela is eager to earn her own income and help her parents with the household expenses.  She has been working in agriculture for one year. 
Anabela is requesting a loan so she can purchase chemical fertilizer and seeds to plant crops this season.  She is a young woman who wants to improve her situation and get her family ahead. 
Anabela dreams of being able to purchase a plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre  está en su ciclo número 14º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son mujeres muy luchadoras que quieren algo mejor para sus familias, por ello se unieron.
 La Señora Gloria es una señora muy humilde ella realiza trabajo de costura, ayuda a su marido de esa forma para la mantener  hogar. Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que está poniendo todo de su para poder crecer y mejorar cada día por medio de su emprendimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y con ello poder cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The "8 de Diciembre" (8th of December) communal bank is in its 14th lending cycle with the Women's Committee program.  All of the women work and help one another to get ahead.  They are very hard-working women who want something better for their families.  That is why the joined together. 
Señora Gloria is a very humble woman who is a seamstress.  That is how she helps her husband to support their household.  She is also the president of the communal bank.  Señora Gloria says that she is putting all her effort into her business venture so she can grow and improve each day. 
She is asking for his loan so she can buy fabric, thread and other items.  That way she will be able to keep working and make her customers happy.  Señora Gloria is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her situation each day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and other items.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Palmas se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 30 años de edad, hace varios años su marido falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvo un  hijo el cual es motivo de felicidad para ella, tiene 8 años de de edad y estudia en una escuela en la localidad. 
Doña Mayra es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante ella sola con su hijo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha la mañana que su hijo está en la escuela para realizar sus recorridos  y  también vende en su casa, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 10  años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante y darle lo necesario a su pequeño.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 4 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group Las Palmas meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited year-round, for its cooking, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Mayra, 30, lives in this place.  Several years ago, her husband passed away and she was left a widow, but from this union she had a son who is a source of happiness for her.  He is eight years old and studies in a local school.
Mayra is a woman who likes to work in order to get ahead alone with her son.  She makes a living in commerce, selling clothing and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She sell door-to-door.  She takes advantage of the morning when her son is in school to make her rounds and she also sells out of her house.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She has been doing this business for 10 years which allows her to get ahead and give the necessities to her little one.
This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams and all she sells.  She has been in the credit group for four years and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead.  Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Marysol

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos, y su negocio es la peluquería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ caracterizado por ser el pulmón de la ciudad, La topografía es pendiente y existen aguas subterráneas. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados. 
Cecilia es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello castaño hasta la altura de los hombros, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana,  su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la peluquería y servicio de belleza; actividad que realiza desde que era adolescente. Comenzó arreglando las uñas de sus clientes como manicure y pedicura,  poco a poco fue aprendiendo sobre la técnica y accedió a cursos de peluquería para profesionalizarse, “para ampliar los servicios de mi salón de belleza, necesitamos un equipo vaporizador para alisar el cabello afro-americano y así mejorar nuestros servicios...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para equipar mejor el salón.  Su sueño es brindar varios servicios dentro de su salón de belleza, ella desea realizar la compra de un equipo vaporizador para brindar el servicio de alisar el cabello afro-americano, Además de protegerlo, volviéndolo más fuerte, hidratado y menos quebradizo. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cecilia solicita un préstamo para la compra de un equipo vaporizador para ampliar la oferta de servicios de su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a woman of 36. She lives with her partner. They have three children, and her business is a beauty salon. 

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. She operates her business in the Villa Fátima zone, which is characterized as being the lung of the city. The topography is sloping, and there are underground waters. It has a cold and dry climate, with an ambient temperature that varies during the day between 2 and 12 degrees centigrade..

Cecilia has a dark complexion and brown eyes and uses magnification lenses. She has brown, shoulder-length hair, medium height, and a medium build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and with her three children, who are of school age. They live in a rented house made of bricks and cement with a tile roof and a wood floor. The house has potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service. 

Her business is a hair-styling and beauty service, a business that she has had since she was an adolescent. She began doing the nails of her customers, both manicures and pedicures. Little by little she learned the techniques and accessed courses in hair styling to become professional. "To expand the services in my beauty salon, we need vaporizing equipment to smooth the hair of African-Americans and thus improve our services," she comments. 

The good thing about her business is that it has regular customers. The problem is the lack of investment capital to equip her salon better. Her dream is to offer various services in her beauty salon. She wants to make the purchase of a vaporizer to offer the service of smoothing African-American hair, in addition to protecting it and making it stronger, hydrated, and less breakable.

She is in her third loan sequence with the institution in the 17 years that she has been running this business. It is for these reasons that Cecilia is applying for a loan to purchase vaporizing equipment to expand the services offered by her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a vaporizer to expand the service offerings of her beauty salon.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité San Francisco, empieza el ciclo 11 del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
Todas son mujeres muy luchadoras que ponen todo de sí para poder crecer, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Maria, presidenta del grupo, ella tiene una despensa que ha montado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy tiene mucha clientela que gracias a su trabajo ha podido mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, frutas, panificados y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "San Francisco" communal bank is beginning its 11th lending cycle with the Enterprising Women's Committee.  The members are putting forth their best effort to improve their own standards of living and their families' as well. 
All of the women are very hard-working and put all of themselves into being able to grow.  Sra. Maria stands out in the group.  She is the president of the communal bank.  She has a small grocery which she set up with a lot of effort and sacrifice.  Now she has a large clientele and thanks to her job, she has been able to improve her situation. 
Sra. Maria is asking for the loan to purchase vegetables, meat, fruit and bakery items among others.  With the purchase, she will be able to keep up with her sales and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, fruits and bakery items, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son 13 mujeres que se unieron para luchan por sus seres queridos, para darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Mariana pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos varios, como ser calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas en la mercería que tiene. Mariana es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Todas las integrantes de este grupo están luchando por poder crecer  mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women) communal bank is in its 1st lending cycle with the Women's Committee program.  All of the members work and help one another to get ahead.  They are thirteen women who joined together to work on behalf of their loved ones, to give them a better quality of life. 

Mariana is requesting this loan so she can purchase various items, such as footwear, clothing, miscellaneous items and so forth.  The purchase will allow her to continue with her sales in the notions store she has.  Mariana is a very hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. 

All of the communal bank members are working to grow and improve their situations each day.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, clothing, miscellaneous items and so forth.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chilies, onion, radish, cilantro, tortillas, meat, canvas for her tricycle and new seats.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son de la ciudad de Ybycuí, cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Lucy, pide este préstamo para  la compra de ingredientes para preparar y vender comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere mejorar y crecer cada día y dar a su familia y a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan.
Las integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy capaces, que quieren capacitarse para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: The Virgen de Fatima group is in their 3rd cycle of the Woman's Committee Program. They are from the city of Ybycuí. Each of them is making their best effort to help their families and loved ones. Lucy is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to prepare and sell meals such as vegetables, meat, condiments, garden produce and others. She is a hard-working woman who struggles each day to improve and grow each day to provide her family and her loved ones all that they need. The members of this group are very capable women who want to study to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, garden produce and others.

loans.name: Hilda Fanny

texts.es: Hilda de 56 años, pertenece a una comunidad cristiana en donde como labor social dictaron cursos de modistería de los cuales se benefició, sin embargo ella avanzaba mucho más que el resto de la clase y tuvo que conseguir otra instructora para que le dictara clases privadas menos básicas.  Posteriormente continuo sus estudios en una caja de compensación familiar y siendo autodidacta por intermedio de revistas y periódicos.  Las prendas que elabora son camisas, blusas, faldas, uniformes y vestidos, sobre medida en los diseños y texturas que el cliente solicite. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una maquina plana y tener una producción de calidad con excelentes acabados. Esta inversión le permitirá cuidar la estética de las prendas y con ello le mejorará el indicador de satisfacción al cliente.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad y cuyo deseo para ellos es que continúen prosperando.  Su meta a futuro es tener un taller con operarias.
texts.en:
Hilda is 56 years old and belongs to a Christian community where she benefited from sewing classes offered as a social work. However, she advanced much more rapidly than the rest of the class and had to find another instructor to give her less basic private classes. Later she continued her studies in a Caja de Compensacion Familiar [Family Welfare Fund] and taught herself by means of magazines and newspapers. 
The garments she produces are shirts, blouses, skirts, uniforms and dresses, custom-fit and according to the design and texture that the client requests. She is currently applying for a first credikiva loan through Fundacion de Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy an industrial machine and produce quality work with excellent finish details. This investment will permit her to manage the aesthetics of the garments and thereby improve client satisfaction. 
She is the mother of four adult children and her desire is that they continue to prosper. Her goal for the future is to have a workshop and employ operators.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and produce high quality work with excellent finish details.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Unidas, están con 19 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras e independientes, con deseos de superación y con ganas de salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Simona,  se la caracteriza por ser emprendedora,  cuenta con una despensa en su casa donde ofrece productos de necesidades básicas del hogar, cuenta con una clientela bien formada, abastece a toda la comunidad. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Simona pide este préstamo para poder abastecerse con productos varios para la venta, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, lácteos, y otros, de manera a poder tener un buen stock que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en: The group known as Mujeres Unidas, is made up of 19 members. They are hard-working and independent with the desire to excel and get ahead. One of the members is Simona who is known as being enterprising. She has a store in her house where she offers basic household items. She has a well formed clientele and she supplies the whole community. She is a fighter who makes the effort to get ahead. Simona is requesting this loan to be able to stock up on a variety of products to sell like vegetables, meat, bakery goods, dairy goods and others so that she has good stock to offer to her clients. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bakery goods, dairy products and others.

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Salvador está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, en una pobreza extrema.
Isabel, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella misma todos los días se levanta a hacer sus comidas, y que son muy aceptados por sus clientes. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y se esfuerza cada día para poder crecer y mejorar.
Isabel pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The "San Salvador" communal bank is in its 1st lending cycle with the Women's Committee program. The members are participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" Program, and three of the women are below the poverty line; they suffer from extreme poverty.

Isabel, one of the members of the communal bank, makes her living selling food. She gets up every day and prepares her food, which is well-liked by her customers. Isabel is a very hard-working woman who makes the effort each day to grow and improve her situation.

Isabel is asking for this loan so she can purchase supplies for making her food. She wants to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens and other items. Then she will be able to continue working, as she is doing now. Isabel is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her situation each day.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meats, condiments, greens and other supplies.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita works hard to support her family. Rodita is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell.

Rodita has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Rodita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of froozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rysbu

texts.ru: Рысбу, 48 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сомов (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, на 3,0 Га земли выращивает люцерну и рис. Гулзада решила развить ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), чтобы заготовить почву для выращивания органических риса и пшеницы. Доходы от кредита Рысбу направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Rysbu is 48 years old, married, and she has one son.  She has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture.  She makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).  She has three cows on her farm and she also grows alfalfa and rice on three hectares of land. Rysbu has decided to develop her business, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to prepare her land to grow organic rice and wheat.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and grow organic rice and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mason's tools and a generator for her son's constructor services.

loans.name: Magella

texts.en:
Magella is 63 years old and married with one child.  She  works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Magella has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, needle, etc.to use.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, needle, etc.to use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish, sugar, wheat, and butter for her kiosk.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a few heifers in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama SANTA ELENA, es un grupo solido se encuentra en el 3er ciclo, es de la ciudad de Santaní, todas son mujeres humildes y emprendedoras, alejadas de una zona rural y aun en crecimiento.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Gloria, ella enseña en una institución educativa en horas de la mañana y por la tarde vende ropas por los lugares cercanos, es muy trabajadora y pone todo su empeño para salir adelante. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The committee is named SANTA ELENA. It is a solid group that is in its third loan cycle, and is located in the city of Santaní. All the members are women of humble backgrounds who are very entrepreneurial, and live far from a rural area, but which is still in development.

One of the members is Mrs. Gloria, she teaches at an educational institution during the mornings, and in the evenings she sells clothes in nearby places. She is very hardworking and gives all her effort to get ahead.

She requests this loan so that she can buy various articles of clothing, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses, among other articles. With this, she will be able to continue striving to improve her living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to make each day better.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses, among other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 50 лет, замужем, есть сын. На протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. Образование у Розы средне-специальное. Начала бизнес с 40,000 сом (KGS) и достигла больших успехов. В хозяйстве имеет 5 коров, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел, на 5,55 ГА она выращивает картофель, пшеницу, ячмень и клевер. Также занимается продажей молока. Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и семян. На доходы от кредита Роза хочет расширить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Roza is 50 years old, married, and she has one son.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for 30 years and she runs her own farm.  The whole family takes an active part and helps with the farm work.  Roza has a specialized-secondary education.  She started her business with 40,000 som (KGS) and she has been quite successful.  She now has five cows and ten sheep on her farm.  She also has a plot of land and she grows potatoes, wheat, barley and clover on 5.5 hectares.  In addition, she sells milk.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock and seeds.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and seeds to invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a popcorn machine, and cooking utensils for her "siomai" and "siopao"

loans.name: Totukan

texts.ru: Тотукан, 59 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1987 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день у Тотукан в хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 21 овца. На 0,56 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тотукан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки молодых ягнят и телят. Доходы от кредита Тотукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Totukan is 59 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 1987.  Having started with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS), she now has seven cows and 21 sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes on 0.56 hectares of land.  She makes an average monthly income of 14,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a few lambs and calves and consequently increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy calves and lambs in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru: Айчурок, 63 года, замужем, 5 детей, она на пенсии. Основной деятельностью Айчурок является сельское хозяйство.  Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе, Айчурок достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства, на сегодня у нее есть 14 коров и 70 овец. Также на земельном наделе мерою 3,60 ГА, Айчурок выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, а также увеличение прибыли от бизнеса, Айчурок обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айчурок планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Aichurok is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She receives a pension.  Her main activity is agriculture.  Thanks to her back-breaking labor and enormous amount of work, she has become quite successful and she has managed to develop her farming business.  Today, she owns 14 cows and 70 sheep.  She also grows alfalfa on 3.6 hectares of land.  In order to further grow her farming business and to increase the profits from her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her farm's livestock headcount.  In the future, she is also planning to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Sophia is in her early 40s, and is single with three kids.  One child is grown-up and the other two are still in school.  She has been running a grocery store for six years now.  She works daily from 4pm to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start a catering business and increased the drinks in her grocery store. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the previous loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to open another grocery store. In the future, she dreams of opening a big bar.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group Wega, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another grocery store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luzvisminda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc for her restaurant.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Luzvisminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Masindi-Uganda.  She sells cosmetics, clothes, and shoes for income generation. Additionally, she farms to boost her income. 

She started the clothing business to support her family and improve their standard of living. She hopes to educate her children, but is affected by the seasonality preferences of her customers, especially during the festive season. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old, married and has five children. Her spouse is a rice farmer, while she is a vendor that sells snacks at the school canteen and also vegetables to her neighbors. 

She wants to increase her sales, but has insufficient funds to maintain her business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy breads, biscuits, juice, and vegetables to sell. 

She hopes to increase her sales and profits to save funds for educational purposes. She will be happy to see her children continuing their studies.

loans.use: to buy more food to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a hair streamer, a hair straighter, and other tools.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 41 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school, Ronalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Ronalyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Ronalyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Remia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and married with one child in school, and she works very hard to provide for her faimly.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Araceli has been in this business for 7 years now.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald lives in Masindi, Uganda, and he is a hardworking, married man with 6 children. 

Gerald sells phones and their accessories, and he is asking for a credit facility to buy solar panels and phones to sell. Inadequate capital is still a challenge in his business. 

He would like to build houses for rent in order to boost his income, and to know that the rental charges will enable him to pay for his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy solar panels and phones to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married, hardworking man living in Masindi-Uganda. He runs a transport business as well as farming to supplement his income. 

He started this business to earn a living and provide for his family's increasing demands. He hopes to build a good house for his family, though he faces a challenge of poor roads that cause constant mechanical break downs, which is an expense to him for repairs.

Fred requests a loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land for farming and to earn more income, in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Ma. Ruberosa

texts.en:
Ma. Ruberosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ma. Ruberosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel  is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school.

She has grown rice for 10 years and  is borrowing 16,000 OGO through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income selling cashews.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a shaded area.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a resident of Masindi-Uganda. He is married, has 4 children, sells clothing, and  farms. 

He started the clothing business to  provide the family with their basic needs. He desires to educate his children and expand his business but has inadequate capital. Habib requests a loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her tricycle and  purchase Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 41 years old and lives in the city of Sevan from the Gegharkunik region. She is married (her husband is a musician) and she has a son. 

Marine  is a skilled farmer in her nice and cute farm.  She has cows, a calf, sheep, and lambs. She and her son sell milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, and meat at the city wholesale market. Marine also has a  vegetable garden to grown potatoes, greens, cucumbers, and tomatoes that she uses for her family.

 Marine’s cattle need fodder and she will be very thankful if Kiva lenders help her to purchase animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 43-year-old married woman with one child attends school, Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 3 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to build and expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en:
Gidion is a cocoa farmer and sells other food crops. He started farming in 1995  to support the family’s increasing demands and educate his 10 children. 

His family desires is to buy more land and increase cocoa harvest. Gidion requests a loan to pay for farm maintenance and labor costs. Gidion’s business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather and high labor costs hindering his returns.

loans.use: to maintain his cocoa gardens.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 37-year-old married man who supports 5 family members. 

He has been a dairy farmer for 12 years and earns 11,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to increase the amount of milk supplied to clients.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edinora

texts.en:
Edinora is a hardworking married woman with 6 children who lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. Her business is cocoa farming and operating a bar . She needs a loan to pay for labor costs to clear her cocoa gardens and increase her harvest. 

She has a great desire to accumulate more capital and become a prominent cocoa dealer in her area although she complains about the unpredictable weather changes and limited capital.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs to clear her cocoa garden.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a forty-five-year-old married health worker  with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He owns a drug business that he started to supplement his  salary and grows cocoa to get enough profit to run his home affairs. He sells drugs to patients around the area and dreams of expanding his business to a big medical center. However, some patients come for treatment, want credit, and do not make payments. He's also challenged by double taxation that cut his profits. 

Ezekiel wants a loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando para ser maestro universitario, es por ello que está estudiando la carrera de didáctica universitaria.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando su situación profesional.
texts.en: Rocio lives in the city of Carapegua and is studying to be a university professor.  Her degree will be in university didactics.  She is a hard-working woman who does everything she can to get ahead.  The loan she is requesting is to buy materials for the university so she can continue improving her professional situation.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Él es Luis es un padre de familia humilde, una persona contratada en su hogar, tiene unos gemelos de 9 años de edad y una princesa de tan solo 7, vive con su pareja y es comerciante, tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y legumbres que inicio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente.

Luis se encuentra solicitando un préstamo pensando en el sostenimiento de su negocio, el cual invertirá en productos para abastecerlo, compra granos, abarrotes y legumbre, siendo un préstamo que apoyara el negocio de un comerciante que quiere salir adelante, buscar un mejor futuro para su familia y servir de ejemplo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This is Luis, a humble family man who lives with his partner and twin sons, age 9, and a lovely daughter, age 7.  He has a grocery store where he sells groceries and legumes, which he started on his own because he wanted an independent job.

Luis is requesting a loan for his business.  He plans to buy inventory such as grains, groceries and legumes.  The loan will help him get ahead in the business, give his family a better future and allow him to set as an example for his children.

loans.use: To buy grains, groceries and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Marta Del Rosario

texts.es:
Marta es propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa interior y trucha. Ella tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a esto y gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito ha podido aumentar su producción, convirtiendo su negocio en próspero y rentable. Inicio vendiendo ambulante y ahora cuenta con un local propio. 

Por lo cual, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar lencería, adornos para el cabello y pescado. Esto le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá ofrecer más productos y aumentar sus ingresos. Marta planea ampliar su negocio y continuar con los financiamientos de MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Martha sells underwear and trout and has been in business for over three years.  Thanks to loans from MiCredito she has been able to increase production and turn her activity into a prosperous, profitable business.  She started out as a street vendor but now has her own shop.

The new loan she is requesting is to buy lingerie, hair accessories and fish.  This will be very helpful since she will be able to offer more products and increase her income.  Marta plans to expand her business and continue using loans from MiCredito.

loans.use: To buy hair accessories and fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Luque,  es soltera, vive con sus padres y es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, está en el último año, desea culminar su carrera para obtener un mejor ingreso y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Maria es una persona muy emprendedora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Luque.  She is single, lives with her parents and is in her last year of studies for an Accounting degree.  She wants to graduate so she can earn more income and also help her family.

Maria is a very enterprising person who does all she can to improve her situation.  She is requesting a loan to pay university costs so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, estudia la carrera de ciencias contables, por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo quiere poder cumplir con sus metas y sus anhelos.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser una profesional útil a las demás personas. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Macarena is from the city of San Ignacio and is studying toward a degree in Accounting.  Through her work and efforts she wants to achieve her goals and desires.

She is doing everything to become a professional to helps others.  The loan she is requesting is to pay university costs so she can continue striving toward her goals.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Chery

texts.en: Chery is a rice farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children who are three and four years old. She has been farming rice since 2011 and she earns PHP 2,500 every harvest season. Chery is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer for her farm. Fertilizer will help so Chery can expect a high yield and increased profits for her children's needs. In the future, Chery plans to engage in other income-generating livelihoods to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, empty plastic bottles, rope, etc. for her seaweed culture business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. Rosemarie earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, empty plastic bottles, rope, etc.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary used the previous loan to buy soap, cooking oil, bread, and biscuits to sell. She is a retailer and at the same time does farming and brick laying in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started these businesses with the hope of earning an income. She has asked for another loan to help her buy general merchandise like cassava flour, soap, rice and salt to sell. Her business is mainly affected by price fluctuations and high license fees.

loans.use: to help her buy general merchandise like cassava flour, soap, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es estudiante de la carrera de Kinesiologia y Fisioterapia en el tercer año de la universidad, es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Arnaldo está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is studying human kinetics and physiotherapy in his third year at university. He is a very hard-working person who strives to be somebody in life.

He is doing all he can to become a successful professional in the future who can help other people.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay off the instalments for his course and be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee installments.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and she supports three family members.
 
She has been a farmer for the last two years and the business earns her an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as jembes and farm inputs such as fertilizer for her farming activity to increase her farming produce and meet client needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes and farm inputs such as fertilizer for her farming activity to increase her farming produce and meet client needs.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy used the previous loan to buy maize, beans and maize flour to sell. He sells produce and at the same time does farming and earns a salary for extra income. He works 12 hours per day and his market is located in a trading center where the population size is favorable for a big number of customers and sales too. Timothy is looking forward to buying a piece of land where he can grow food crops on a large scale. He has asked for a loan to buy more cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Sid Zabda Yaoba Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA JULIENNE est responsable du groupe SID ZABDA YAOBA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans  et le moins âgé  a  12ans   . Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits prêt à porter et des pagnes depuis  13ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  06pièces pagnes et 02douzaines d’habits.
Mme veut épargner une partie de ses bénéfices et s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Awa Julienne is the representative of the Sid Zabda Yaoba Group. She is a married mother to two children. Her eldest is 24 years old and her youngest is 12. Both of them are currently receiving an education. She has five people living under her care.

Awa Julienne has been selling ready-to-wear clothing and traditional pagne wax cloth for the past 13 years. She gets her supplies from the local markets. She wants to purchase six sheets of traditional pagne wax cloth and two dozen garments. Awa Julienne wants to put aside part of the profits into her savings and use the rest to look after her family. Her dream is to open a large store.

loans.use: to purchase six sheets of traditional pagne wax cloth and two dozen garments

loans.name: La Bass Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAHINATA est responsable du groupe LA BASS. Veuve, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 39ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. 01 va à l'école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des jus et parallèlement des pagne, des bazins depuis 30ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes environnantes.
Elle veut s'acheter 10sacs de bisaps pour la préparation du jus et 20pièces de pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour son activité et s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rihanata is the representative of the La Bass Group. She is a widowed mother to five children. Her eldest is 39 years old and her youngest is 20. One of them is currently receiving an education. Rihanata has four people living under her care.

She has been selling juice drinks, as well as traditional pagne wax cloth, for the past 30 years. She gets her supplies from nearby villages. She wants to purchase 10 sacks of dried hibiscus flowers for making juice and 20 sheets of pagne wax cloth. She wants to reinvest her profits back into her business. Her dream is to open a stall from which she can run her business. She also strives to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of dried hibiscus flowers for making juice and 20 sheets of pagne wax cloth

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es de la ciudad de Encarnación,  está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Él está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, comenta que quiere ser una persona útil a la sociedad, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
David comes from a city called Encarnacion. He is studying accountancy at University. He is doing all he can to improve his quality of life, both for himself and for his family.

He is working hard in order to improve and be successful. He wants to be a person who can help society.

He is asking for this loan so he can pay the installments of his course fees and be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees in installments.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una persona trabajadora y estudiosa, comenta que su meta es recibirse de administradora de empresas agropecuarias y tener su propia empresa.
Ella es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de estudiar.
texts.en:
Miguelina is a very hard-working and studious person. Her goal is to finish a degree in agricultural management and she would like to start her own business.

She is doing all she can to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay off the installments for her course fees. Then she will be able to continue with her studies. She is very grateful for the opportunity to be able to go to university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Asante Group

texts.en: Zabibu (second from left) is requesting a new loan to add more soda and beer to her stock to resell. From this, she will be able to make more money for her family. After her previous loan, her profits grew tremendously and now all of her children are able to study at school and she can pay the school fees without difficulty.

loans.use: To buy more stock of soda and beer for sale

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en: Veasna is 23 years old, single and working for a company in the city. He is from the Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has worked in the company since 2014, making an income of USD 12 per day. Currently, Veasna is pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his fourth-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the fourth year successfully. For his dreams, Veasna wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year tuition fees

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando para ser radiólogo, comenta que quiere culminar sus estudios para poder ser un buen profesional de la salud.
El comenta que está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando por sus estudios.
texts.en:
Danilo lives in the city of Caaguazu. He is studying radiology. He would like to finish his studies so he can become a successful health professional. He is doing all he can to be able to achieve this goal and be somebody in life.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay off his university course installments.

He is grateful for the opportunity to keep studying hard.

loans.use: to pay university fees in installments.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moises esta estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en electricidad, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino y poder dar a su familia una ayuda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en cubrir sus gastos de manutención.
Hoy pide nuevamente esta préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Moises is studying electrical engineering at university. With this degree, he would like to have more opportunities for employment and be able to help his family to have a better quality of life.

He used his last loan to cover his expenses. Now he is asking for a new loan to be able to pay off the instalments of his university course. This will enable him to carry on studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad, está cursando el primer año, actualmente está trabajando a la vez que estudia.
Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ser un profesional para así poder ejercer su profesión y así poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose is studying accountancy in his first year. He is also currently working as well as studying.

His greatest desire in life is to become a professional in his chosen profession and therefore be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay off the installments for his course so that he can carry on studying like he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
Thanks to you lenders, Sarlyn was recently granted a PHP 20,000 loan to increase her inventory. With this amount, she bought more merchandise products associated with her direct selling business. Having been able to achieve increased sales, Sarlyn found this to be a better source of income for her family. Thus, she was able to support her household's basic needs. 

However, Sarlyn still needs to borrow a certain amount to help her maintain her business's operations. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 that she will use to buy additional items to sell such as clothes, bags, cosmetics and other similar products. Your help today can be a great start for the better business and life that lies ahead for Sarlyn. This is why she is very hopeful that you will help her with her request. 

Sarlyn dreams that her children will graduate from college and become professionals some day. Plus, she hopes to be able to get the opportunity to franchise goods in due time. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as clothes, bags, cosmetics and other similar products.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Thank you lenders! You are such a great help to Vivian. What you have lent her recently was able to help her provide for the daily expenses of her household and develop her business (sari-sari store).   

As her business expands, she would again like to take out a loan worth PHP 8,000. She would use this to buy additional products to sell like grocery items and other similar products. You have once proved to her that God has been faithful in her life. She believes that you will help her again this time. 

Someday, she hopes for a better life for her children. She prays that they will always have good health and that her business will grow more and expand. 

Vivian meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like grocery items and other similar products.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. Manuela is dependent on her hog-raising business for a living. She started raising hogs in 2010 and she earns 5,000 PHP every time she sells her pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and food for her family, like noodles and rice. She dreams of having a prosperous business so she can also help to raise her grandchildren so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs and food for her family like noodles and rice

loans.name: Mary Boyani

texts.en:
My name is Mary. I am from Nyamira County. I come from a family of six members: one boy and five girls.

I studied in Nyabururu girls secondary, a local school. My parents are small-scale farmers, hence our family income is very limited.

At Nyabururu I attained a B+ grade even after going through many financial challenges. I am keen to pursue a Bachelor of Commerce degree, but cannot afford it.

My passion of becoming an accountant since childhood has led to Strathmore University where I found out about the Kiva loan opportunity. I have no other financial option to meet my university education; Kiva is my only way out of poverty.

Strathmore will give me the opportunity to make my dream a reality by offering me a chance to study in the institution through the partnership with Kiva.
I will make the best out of this opportunity that promises a bright future not just for myself but for my family, the people of Nyamira and the world.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 49, is married to Joel and supports seven family members. She has been selling raw fish in the market for the last 10 years. This business earns Grace a monthly income of KES 12,000.
 
Grace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stocks of fish to sell at the market. This will  meet the customers' demands and her family's needs. Grace plans to use the profit she earns to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Michelle Akinyi

texts.en:
My name is Michelle, the fourth born in a family of seven and I live with both my parents who depend on casual jobs for their livelihood.

I have always had a dream of going to University to pursue a course which will help me get a job in order to assist my family. Always, I have tried my level best to work hard. In primary school for example I managed to top all the classes in primary school, where I became the top candidate in the Kenya Certificate of Primary Education in my school in 2010.

I remember a statement that my tutor told me one day in high school, “Never set your bar low just because you feel that’s where you belong.“ That statement made me never give up on my dream of going to Strathmore University.

My aim is to use my degree to venture into various business opportunities so as to assist my family and also inspire young Kenyans to never let the opinion of others determine who they are. I believe that the most successful people are the ones who have been told negative statements several times but never quit.

loans.use: To pay for the Bachelor of Commerce degree

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, el comenta que lucha por un mejor estilo de vida para el y sus seres queridos, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide de este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Blas is studying accountancy at university. He is working very hard to be able to progress and become someone in life.

He tells us that he is striving for a better quality of life, both for himself and for his family.

He used his last loan to pay off his tuition fees. Now he is asking for a new loan to do the same so he can carry on with his studies like he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
It just takes a seed of faith to move mountains. 

This is Zenaida and she was able to repay the loan she got previously worth PHP 10,000. This wouldn't be possible without your help, lenders. Thank you so much! Through you, she was able to buy enough supplies of ingredients needed for her business, thus, paving the way to a better remedy for her family's daily expenses. 

Growing her business, she would like to ask again for a loan worth PHP 12,000. This would be a big help for her food stall. She would use this amount to improve her food stall business by acquiring more stocks of ingredients needed in her recipes. 

Help Zenaida see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream to having her own restaurant and seeing her children become professionals in the future, she works very hard to help her husband sustain the family. 

Zenaida meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to improve her food stall business by acquiring more stocks of ingredients needed in her recipes.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven que lucha día a día a la par de trabajar tiene que   estudiar gracias al apoyo de su familia humilde.
Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos a tener una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a young man who is working very hard, and at the same time is studying thanks to the support of his humble family.

He is studying accounting. Through his studies he wants to be able to help his loved ones to have a better life.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition fees and thus continue his studies the way he is doing. He is very thankful for receiving this opportunity to improve.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin vive en la ciudad de concepción, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en informática, está poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Martin lives in a city called Concepcion. He is making a big effort to be able to get along in life and to improve his standard of living.

He is studying a degree in information technology at university. He is doing all he can so that his studies will allow him to help his family.

He is asking for this loan to pay his tuition fees so that he can continue striving to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Making clothes is like shaping your life. Before an end-product is produced, the fabric needs to be cut around its edges and pierced with the needle. 

Despite this, Elizabeth still has her spirit. She is only 28 years of age and there is nothing that she won't do for her two children. Currently, she is involved in her tailoring business in their community in Pasay City, Philippines. Selling from this inventory has already helped her a lot in maintaining her household. 

Elizabeth dreams that her business will expand and grow as it progresses. To start reaching this dream, she needs your help. Elizabeth would like to take out a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional supplies of materials, such as needles, fabrics and threads, to make more clothes; and to use a portion of the loan to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine. 

Today, Elizabeth is diligent and hard-working in her trade. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as needles, fabrics and threads, to make more clothes; and to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Patrick Wairi

texts.en:
My name is Patrick. I was born in Gakoe-ini, a remote village in Murang’a County. Being the last born in a family of six, I have witnessed the struggle my parents and other siblings have gone through to make ends meet. My parents never had any formal employment and on a small plot of land they practiced farming, which barely supported  the family. I was schooled in local primary and secondary schools. Despite the limited resources and fees problems, I persisted and completed school.
 
The audacity to have an impactful future has led me to seek a Kiva loan to study at Strathmore University. I have therefore enrolled to start in June 2015, working on a Bachelor of Business and Information Technology degree.

I aspire to make positive contributions to the society I live in. I am already a member of a local football club and I will engage in co-curricular activities actively at  Strathmore University. I believe in volunteer work since it is fulfilling to care for humanity.
 
I believe in an empowered society. That is why I have a profound desire to study at Strathmore University. Not only to pass in academic units, but to be transformed, gaining in ethical, moral and dignified leadership. I possess immense potential and I am seeking this loan to keep me in school, to enable me tap into wisdom and to develop the expertise needed to be competitive not only in the job market but also in entrepreneurship and care for humanity. I have a dream to be a successful entrepreneur, creating jobs and inspiring young Kenyans.

loans.use: to pay for a Bachelor of Business and Information Technology degree.

loans.name: Jennifer Muthoni

texts.en:
My name is Jennifer, the first-born in a family of two children. I am currently studying CPA section 1 at Strathmore University on a scholarship from Strathmore University. In the few months that I have been at Strathmore University, I have developed the desire to pursue a degree in Bachelor of Commerce. My choice of Strathmore is influenced by their emphasis on quality and developing an all-around professional person.

Though I have this desire, my parents cannot afford to pay for my school fees. This is because my mother is a housewife and my dad is a casual worker. Their combined incomes cannot be able to pay for both my tuition and up-keep; this is why I am applying for the Kiva tuition loan.

The loan will be sufficient to cater for my tuition and thus accomplish my dream of becoming an auditor. I have a great passion for community service, and I would have a purpose to serve my community in assisting needy students to fund their education, once I finish my studies at Strathmore University.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce.

loans.name: Millicent Atieno

texts.en:
My name is Millicent. I am a highly committed individual who always strives to achieve a high standard in whatever I do.
 
I belong to a family of five members who live together in our family house. Both my parents are teachers. I have two siblings, a brother and a sister. 

My personal strengths are determination, generosity, consideration for others and the ability to use my initiative. I also try to see things from other people’s points of view. 
  
I love sporting activities -- basketball to be precise. 
 
I realize I have a responsibility and a lot is expected from me given the opportunity to be a beneficiary of Kiva. I look forward to our partnership.

loans.use: to pay for an Actuarial Science Bachelor degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animal food and small animals to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes (digging hoes) and farm inputs such as fertilizer for his farming activity

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es: Santos de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de granos básicos, posee más de 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, vende sus productos agrícolas en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, y con lo que obtiene se sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otras cosas y así poder tener mejores cosechas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, 42, lives in his own home with his family. He works in agriculture, sowing basic grains. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He sells his products in the area near where he lives. He uses the money he makes to put towards the household expenses.  

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, and other agricultural products. This will enable him to have a better harvest, which in turn give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado LA ESPERANZA está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar cada día, ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras que quieren salir adelante y crecer.
Cinthia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de chipa que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus chipas, como ser almidón, queso, huevos, manteca y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called La Esperanza [the hope] is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group of people, who give their all to be able to grow and improve everyday. They are very hard-working women, who want to improve their financial situation and grow.

Cintia is one member of this group. She is earning a living selling chipas [cheesy buns, typical of Paraguay]. She prepares them herself and then sells them as a street vendor. She is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working woman, who gives her all to be able to grow and be someone in life.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in buying ingredients, such as starch, cheese, eggs, butter, to be able to keep making her chipas. She is thankful for receiving the opportunity to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as starch, cheese, eggs, butter, for making chipas to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима, 29 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей, работает в школе учителем. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Салима начала свой бизнес по разведению скота, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, настойчивости и трудолюбию, Салима сумела развить бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 17,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Салимы есть 2 коровы. В целях развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Салима планирует вложить в расширение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Salima is 29 years old and married.  She raises two children and works as a school teacher.  In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she started her own animal husbandry business with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her dedication, persistence and hard work, she managed to grow her business and she currently makes a monthly income of 17,000 som (KGS).  Today, she has two cows on her farm.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC to further develop her business.  She is taking a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her livestock headcount.
