texts.es: Jose vive en el campo, es casado y tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, Jose tiene 60 años y comenta que se dedica  desde muy joven al jornal y a la agricultura, la esposa de Jose también se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajos del campo. Jose solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de semilla de papas y abono para cultivar este producto. Jose sigue adelante en sus cultivos si espera tener una buena cosecha para seguir apoyando a sus hijos y a su vez a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the country. He is married and has 4 children who are already grown. Jose is 60 years old and from a young age has made his living in agriculture and as a daily laborer. Jose's wife also makes a living doing daily wage work in the fields.

Jose is applying for the loan to invest it in buying seedling potatoes and compost to grow them. Jose moves forward with his crops if he expects to have a good harvest, in order to continue supporting his children as well as his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy seedling potatoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 47-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He operates a boutique, the business he started with a hope of earning an income. He faces challenges of low capital that hinders expansion of his business to new market areas. However, he has future hopes of having all his children educated.

David needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fazl

texts.en: Fazl is 47 years old and a widow. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their family members. Fazl requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida  is 45 years old, a married woman. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Zahida  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market and improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow as well as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm; she hopes this will enable her to get more milk and farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her child who is doing a midwifery course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land and expand her farming activity.

loans.name: Luis Richard

texts.es:
Luis es un joven hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de economía en la universidad.
Él es inteligente, paciente, buen oyente, solidario, amable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza la universidad pública situada en la zona central, área que sirve de punto de intersección entre calles, con un tráfico vehicular muy complicado, en medio se encuentra la biblioteca municipal. El comercio se realiza las 24 horas eso ocasiona que el lugar siempre se encuentre en movimiento, con una amplia oferta de opciones: cafés, restaurantes, museos, etc. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-15 grados centígrados. 
Luis es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la realiza trabajando y estudiando, vive en una casa en anticrético (especie de alquiler) construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Él trabaja como oficial de microcréditos en un banco desde hace 4 años, Y estudia la carrera de economía en 3 año de 5 años, “estoy finalizando mis estudios y esto requiere el pago de seminarios...” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios de ambas no se cruzan, la desventaja es la falta de apoyo económico para pagar las actividades académicas finales. Su sueño es terminar su carrera para obtener un mejor puesto de trabajo, El desea realizar el pago de seminario de actualización en normas contables y financieras. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que trabaja en el sector financiero.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para pagar los seminarios finales de actualización en normas contables y obtener un mejor puesto laboral.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man 27 years of age who is single and has no children. He is majoring in economics at the university. He is intelligent, patient, a good listener, caring, friendly, and a very hard worker.

He is studying at a public university in the central zone, an area where the streets intersect and that has a very complicated traffic pattern, and in the middle of which is the municipal library. Businesses operate 24 hours a day, which means the place is always bustling and offers a wide range of options: cafes, restaurants, museums, etc. It has a cold and dry climate with a daytime temperature of between 0 and 15 degrees Celsius (between 32 and 60 degrees Fahrenheit).

Luis has a dark complexion and brown eyes, eyeglasses, short black hair, a short stature, and a thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family. Otherwise he speaks Spanish in general and in his studies.

He spends his life working and studying. He lives in a rental house which is brick with a corrugated iron roof and a wood floor. It has running water, electricity, gas, and plumbing.

Luis has worked as a microcredit officer at a bank for 4 years, and he is in his 3rd of a 5-year economics degree. "I am finishing my studies, and this requires me to pay for the seminars," he says.

The advantage of his activities is that the schedules do not coincide. The disadvantage is the lack of economic support to pay for his final academic requirements. His dream is to finish his degree so that he can get a better job. He wants to pay for the refresher seminar on accounting and financial regulations. This is the second round of loans with the institution in the 4 years that he has worked in the financial sector.

These are the reasons why Luis is applying for a loan to pay for his final refresher seminars on accounting regulations and to get a better job.

loans.use: to pay for the final refresher seminars on accounting regulations and to get a better job.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбару  50 лет. Она замужем и мать  двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Дочка уже замужем и живет отдельно. Сын учится в университете, в этом году он заканчивает университет. Муж водитель такси. Его доходы от этой деятельности. Сама Дилбар бизнес - леди.  Она занимается продажей возле рынка. Дилбар продает огурцы, помидоры, чакка, чеснок и болгарский. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить доход. Дилбар собирается взять кредит, и за счет кредита купить больше овощи на продажу. Она с такими планами обратилась  к Вам на помощь.
texts.en: Dilbar is 50 years old. She is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her daughter is already married and lives separately. Dilbar's son is in his last year of studies a the university. Dilbar’s husband makes a living as a taxi driver. As to Dilbar, she is an entrepreneur selling food items near the market. Dilbar sells cucumbers, tomatoes, “chakka” [traditional strained youghurt], garlic and sweet peppers. Dilbar would like to increase her sales volume and earn higher revenues. She plans to take out a loan to  stock up on vegetables for resale. This is why she is turning to you for support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda, is aged 41 years and married with four children of 12, 8, 6, and 4 years. His main business is cattle trade, supplemented by milk sales.

He has hopes of exploring in the cattle markets with more attractive prices and a personal goal of building a permanent home for his family as well as educating his children to university. His hardships are prolonged drought and inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Morelos Group

texts.es:
Dentro de una comunidad veracruzana se festeja en el mes de mayo el fin de la zafra o cosecha de caña, y para ello se lleva a cabo un desfile por las calles principales. Los llamados “reyes de la alegría” realizan un recorrido sobre carros alegóricos; también asisten comparsas y se escuchan distintos estilos musicales. 
    En esta región se conformó el grupo Morelos que está integrado por siete personas productivas y amables, ellos son: Celia S. quien vende miel; Ángela, refresco; Beatriz, cerdos; Celia C., comida típica; Antolina, pollo; Carmela, zapatos y Miguel que tiene una carpintería. 
    Doña Beatriz, o Bety como le llaman de cariño, decidió auto emplearse y gracias al primer préstamo que VisiónFund México le otorgó, pudo comprar un cerdo para su crianza.  Con ayuda de Julio, su esposo, construyó un corral y desde entonces se dedica ampliamente a dicha actividad. Hoy en día tiene cuatro chiqueros para mantener a los animales en las mejores condiciones posibles; los separa de acuerdo con su edad y durante los primeros días de nacidos debe darles suero, vitaminas y suficiente alimento. Sus animales obtienen todos los cuidados pues por las mañanas los alimenta y lava el corral; a medio día repite el proceso  y por la noche les da otra ración de alimento. Otro elemento principal es el agua, por lo que mandó construir dos bebederos en donde se refrescan los animales.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado apoyar a su esposo económicamente y sus tres hijas pudieron terminar de estudiar. Cada uno de los préstamos que se le han otorgado los ha invertido en la compra de cerditos, alimento y suero para vender animales de alta calidad. Debido a esto, los carniceros de otras comunidades le compran sus ejemplares. “Estoy feliz, en una semana o días he vendido hasta 18,000 pesos, obtener mis propias ganancias me hace sentir a gusto conmigo”.
   Esta vez con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá invertir en 7 cerditos más y alimento de crecimiento. Estabilizarse y tener hasta 15 cerdos es su próximo reto y espera cumplirlo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

   *La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín de la región, Doña Bety es quien viste blusa café con vivos floreados, los niños que aparecen son nietos e hijos de algunos integrantes.
texts.en:
In this community in Veracruz the zafra or the end of the sugar cane harvest is celebrated in May with a parade that runs through through the main streets. The so called "Kings of Joy" make their trip on allegorical vehicles, there are dancing troupes and different styles of music are heard.

In this region the "Morelos" group was formed make up of seven productive and friendly people. They are: Celia S. who sells honey; Ángela, soft drinks; Beatriz, pigs; Celia C., traditional food; Antolina, chicken; Carmela, shoes y Miguel has a carpenter shop.

Beatriz, or Bety as she is known with love dedicated to work for herself and thanks to the first loan that VisiónFund México awarded her she bought a pig to raise. With the help of Julio her husband, she built an enclosure and since then she has worked hard at this business.

Today she has 4 pigpens to keep her animals in the best possible conditions. she separates them according to their age and in the first days after birth she has to feed them serum, vitamins and sufficient food. Her animals get proper care as in the morning they are feed and the enclosures cleaned. The process is repeated at noon and they are feed again at night. Another principal element is water and she built two troughs where the animals can drink.

With her profits she has managed to help her husband economically and her three daughters can finish their studies. Each loan she has been given has been invested in buying pigs, food and medicine to sell animals of high quality. Thanks to this butchers from other communities buy her animals. "I am happy in a week or so I have sold about 18,000 pesos and made my own profit which makes me pleased with myself".

With this loan she will buy 7 pigs and more growth feed. Her next challenge is to stabilize her business and have 15 pigs and she hopes to achieve this to satisfy the demand from her customers. The photograph was taken in the regional garden. Bety is wearing the brown blouse with bright flowers. The children in the photo are grandchildren and children of some of the members.

loans.use: to buy 7 pigs and feed.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 39-year-old married Lebanese woman with three children, one of whom is still attending school. She has worked as a private teacher since 2000 to give her husband support and be able to fulfil her children’s needs. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and has equipped it with the required materials and supplies. 

Today, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new car. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Wamama Tupatane Group

texts.en: Machozi is the featured borrower for the Wezesha Project Group Wamama Tupatane. She is a married mother of seven children. Her business is selling cooking oil. She intends to use this loan to buy cooking oil in large quantities. She expects her business to progress well and earn more profit to enable her to actively participate in managing her family's nutritional needs.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Dos De Mayo-Chancamayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO-CHANCAMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es conviviente y tiene 39 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “DOS DE MAYO-CHANCAMAYO” communal bank. It is located in the district of Quellouno, which belongs to the province of La Convencion and Cusco department.

Teresa is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship and has four children. She works in her business growing fruit. She has land where she plants bananas, coffee. mandarins and oranges. She works from 6 am until 5 pm. She has been in this business for a number of years and things are going well. Her dream is to extent her area of cultivation. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other members work selling animals, an agriculture business, a grocery store and a business selling meals. She thanks those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hülya

texts.en:
Hülya is divorced and has a child. After her divorce she began sewing at home and gaining money. Later on she started making jewelry and selling it. She heard about microcredit from her friend and wanted to apply. With her first loan she purchased materials for her jewelry. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy more materials for her jewelry and develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hülya hanım eşinden ayrı bir çocuk annesi. Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra ihtiyaçtan dolayı evde dikiş dikmeye başlamış. Son yıllarda takı yaparak satmaya başlamış. Mikro krediyi arkadaşından duymuş ve oda faydalanmak istemiş. İlk kredisi ile takı malzemeleri alarak üretip satmaya başlamış ikinci kredi ile tekrar takı malzemesi alarak üretip satarak para
kazanmak istiyor ve işini geliştirmeyi düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows so as to enable him to transport his already made bricks for sale to clients and earn a living from brick sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm in the hope this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for the business like sugar, shopping bags, rice and others to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a printer for use in his service for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for fish, and fuel.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ahora está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 7 hijos pero solo los dos menores viven con ella.

Actualmente, Lucrecia se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, ya tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este trabajo con su esposo, además cultiva la tierra pues siembra maíz y maicillo para vender y consumir.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar cerdos para criarlos y luego venderlos

Su sueño a futuro es tener una granja grande de cerdos y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 49 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study and now she married. Her husband is a farmer and they have seven children but only the two youngest live with her.

Currently, Lucrecia makes her living raising and selling pigs. She has had this business for 8 years with her husband. They also farm, planting corn and sorghum to sell and for their own consumption.

She is requesting this loan to buy pigs to raise and later resell. Her dream for the future is to have a large pig farm and be able to get her younger children ahead.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise them and resell them later.

loans.name: Rock

texts.en: Rock, a resident of Sanga town, is a hardworking 40-year-old man with two children and one dependent, a son of his late brother. All his children and dependents are in good schools and depending on him for survival. He is a doctor but according to him he says his family cannot depend on his salary and that’s why he is improving his banana plantation by adding manure, especially cow dung. Because of all his family responsibilities, he decided to begin banana plantation farming. He is able to supply Sanga and Mbarara, so he wants 5,000,000 UGX to buy manure and other mulches to increase output from this plantation. His dream is to yield more matooke from his plantations, afford to pay school fees for his children and look after the whole family.

loans.use: To obtain cow dung to use as manure for his farm.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 44-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and six children, four of whom are still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in her family and has worked as a van driver for seventeen years. Due to the hard financial situation and in order to better support her family, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that she is very happy because this loan will help her to change her children’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is a hardworking woman from Sanga trading centre, Kiruhura district. She does farming and has planted three acres of corn and beans. However, she does not have money to pay labourers to do the weeding and that’s why she came for a loan. In addition, she wants to use part of the loan proceeds to finish up her rental houses in Sanga town. She has dreams of earning a lot of income which will help her to buy more land for planting more maize and beans to increase food production in the area.

loans.use: to pay for labour for weeding her corn  and bean gardens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides to boost productivity for more income so as to improve family health care.

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.en: Mukunde (center in picture) is the leader of the Bora Group from Wezesha Project. She says she couldn't continue running this business without the help of Wezesha Project because she is still in the process of expanding it. With this loan, Mukunde will purchase more used shoes to sell at the market. With her profits, she hopes to pay school fees and to repair her roof.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell at the market.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en: Neelam has been providing education to children from low income communities for 6 years. She started with a handful of students, but today the school has 120 students, 73% of whom are girls. Neelam believes that every child should be treated justly and that every child deserves the best possible education, irrespective of being rich or poor. She constantly tries to improve teaching quality and comfort for children in her school. For this purpose, Neelam has requested a loan for 110,000 PKR. Her plan is to renovate some rooms in her school, to purchase new fans, and to place a water cooler in her school to help children beat the scorching heat this summer.

loans.use: to renovate some rooms in her school, to purchase new fans, and to place a water cooler in her school to help children beat the scorching heat this summer.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 26-year-old young woman from Khobi district. She has a husband, three children, parents-in-law and a brother-in-law who works as a hired worker and gets a small income. The father-in-law is also a driver and generates 250 GEL monthly. The family has had an agribusiness for 10 years already and sells the products at the local market. In particular, they produce cheese, harvest nuts and laurel and also sell pigs at the local market. However, they have poor living conditions, as the family is too large and needs much money to make financial stability.

Lana planned to expand the agribusiness, as it is a profitable activity in this region. She requested a loan from Credo to purchase cattle. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Lana will sell meat at the local market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cattle and start selling meat

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is a mechanic. He is married and has three kids to feed. Marcelino needs a loan to buy tools for his workshop. 

Year after year, Marcelino has been investing in his workshop, and it is going well. Marcelino has his own house. He is healthy, and he loves his family a lot. His wife is not working, but she takes care of the children. Marcelino hopes you can help him give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.en: In order to fulfill her dreams, Saleh (second from the right in the picture), the leader of Matumaini Group, is requesting another loan. With this loan, she will purchase more soap and cooking oil. All members of the Matumaini group finished their last loan without any problems. Saleh used the profits she made with her previous loan to send her kids to school (by paying their school fees).

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mayra Lourdes

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 34 años de edad, solo estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un hijo que está estudiando y depende de ella.

Mayra se dedica a la venta de ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc, siendo estya su principal fuente de ingresos pero además se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


Este préstamo le servirá a Mayra para comprar camisas para hombres, blusas para mujeres, pantalones para adultos y también ropa para niños y comercializarla.

Como toda madre que desea lo mejor para su hijo ella sueña con ver que él sea un profesional en un futuro.
texts.en: Mayra is 34 years of age. She only studied through high school and is a single mother of one son who is in school and depends on her. Mayra makes a living selling clothing like blouses, t-shirts, pants, underwear, etc. This is her main source of income but she also works as a domestic worker. This loan will help Mayra to buy men's shirts, blouses, pants for adults and also children's clothing and sell it. Like all mothers who wish the best for their child, she dreams of seeing her son as a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, blouses, pants for adults and also children's clothing and sell it.

loans.name: Nibale

texts.en: Nibale is a 43-year-old married mother of two children who attend school. She is a housewife and her husband is the main source of income for the family. He has worked in the Lebanese army since 1990 and also works as a farmer. Today, Nibale is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s school fees. She is very thankful to Kiva because it will permit her to help her children achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Она Сафаргул, Ей 51 год. Сафаргул вместе с мужем фермером воспитывают двоих детей и помогают родителям пенсионерам. Сафаргул более 5 лет продвигает свою торговую деятельность. У нее не большой магазин, где продает товары первой необходимости. В ассортимент ее товара входят, начиная с макарон до спичек. Полки магазина пустуют и Сафаргулу необходимо привести новый товар. Но из-за не достаточной суммы денег на приобретения товара и привозку у нее не хватает денежных средств и Сафаргул обратилась за заемными средствами. Сафаргул заранее благодарит за помощь и искреннее надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Safargul. She is 51 years old. Safargul and her husband, who is a farmer, are raising two children. They also help their parents who are retired. 

Safargul has worked with her own retail business for more than five years. She has a small store, where she sells basic commodities. Her assortment includes everything from pasta to matches. 

Currently her shelves are empty, and Safargul needs to bring in new goods. However, she does not have the sufficient amount of money to purchase goods and transport them. Therefore she applied for a loan. Safargul thanks for the help in advance and sincerely hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase and transport basic commodities for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell and serve more customers.

loans.name: Manuela Esther

texts.es: Manuela hace dos años emprendió su propio negocio por una situación familiar y la necesidad de generar los  ingresos que le permitieran aportar a la economía del hogar; con mucha fortaleza exploró las diferentes alternativas de negocio y hoy en día comercializa todo los artículos que le presentan oportunidad de negocio: ventas por catálogos, artesanías, muebles y artículos para el hogar, actividad que ejecuta de lunes a domingo con una clientela compuesta por vecinos, familiares y referidos. Sus deseos de crecer la motivaron a aplicar a su primer crediKiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, e invertir en floreros, cuadros, mecedoras, ropa y cosméticos, iniciativa que esta emprendedora de 58 años a largo plazo planea materializar en su ideal de organizar un local comercial donde pueda exhibir su mercancía y generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Manuela started her own business due to a family situation and the need to generate income that would permit her to contribute to household expenses. 

With much fortitude, she explored different business alternatives, and today she sells all sorts of items that present her a business opportunity: catalogues, handmade goods, furniture and items for the home. She carries out this activity Monday through Sunday with a clientele composed of neighbors, family and referrals. 

Her desire to grow motivated her to apply for her first crediKiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and invest in flower vases, paintings, rocking chairs, clothing and cosmetics—an initiative that this 58 year-old entrepreneur plans to materialize into her goal, to organize a local store when she can display her merchandise and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy flower vases, paintings, rocking chairs, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
Para cierta comunidad veracruzana ubicada a un costado de la carretera federal el mes de mayo es sinónimo de fiesta y alegría pues celebran  al santo patrono de la región. Los habitantes de la localidad y de los lugares aledaños se dan cita para participar en los eventos culturales programados. Las calles se visten de colores y la música es reflejo del gran ambiente que se vive. 
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo integrado por cinco mujeres  trabajadoras quienes decidieron llamarse Las Fresitas haciendo referencia a que su grupo es exclusivo. Ellas son: Emma y Brenda quienes venden tacos; María, comida,  ropa y artículos de oro laminado; Celia y Liliana, antojitos típicos. 
   Brenda es una joven madre de cuatro hijos, uno de ellos tiene un problema con sus piernas por lo que acude a terapia con regularidad. Ella forma parte de una familia dedicada a la venta de tacos; así surgió el amor que tiene por esta actividad y desde hace catorce años tiene su propia taquería. En tan sólo 6 meses logró adquirir una clientela constante  y con ello el crecimiento del negocio, la evolución es evidente pues al inicio sólo vendían ella y su madre y hoy día da empleo a tres personas más. Parte de su éxito se basa en el gran sabor del producto además de la excelente atención al cliente como, por ejemplo, las promociones al dos por uno que ofrece ciertos días.
   Con las ganancias ha brindado una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, sobre todo al mayor quien acude a su terapia hasta la ciudad de Veracruz que se ubica a un par de horas de su comunidad aproximadamente. Esta vez su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, verduras, tortillas, aceite, refrescos y gas continuando de esta manera con la venta de lunes a domingo a partir de las 4 de la tarde y hasta la media noche.  "Estoy contenta y feliz por la gran familia que tengo, por mis hijos haré todo cuanto pueda, la taquería ha rendido los frutos esperados, después comprare más mesas y sillas para  ampliar el negocio”.

 *La fotografía fue tomada en la taquería de Brenda, ella es quien viste blusa blanca y pesquero color negro.
texts.en:
For a Veracruz community located off of the federal highway, the month of May is synonymous with celebration and joy for celebrating the patron saint of the region. The people of the town and the surrounding areas gather to participate in the cultural events that occur. The streets are filled with colors and the music reflects the great atmosphere that prevails.

In this community, a group of five working women formed. They decided to call themselves “Las Fresitas” (The Wild Strawberries), referring to the group’s uniqueness. The members are: Emma and Brenda, who sell tacos; Maria, who sells food, clothes and gold-layered jewelry; Celia and Liliana, who sell typical snacks.

Brenda is a young mother of four children. One of them has a problem with his legs, so he regularly attends therapy. She grew up as part of a family that sells tacos; this is how the love for the work formed, and now she has had her own taqueria for fourteen years. In just six months she managed to acquire a steady clientele, and with that, was able to grow her business. The evolution is apparent, as in the beginning only she and her mother sold the tacos, and now she employs three more people. Part of her success is based on the great taste of the product and the excellent customer service she provides, such as offering two for one promotions on certain days.

With her profits she has provided a good quality of life for her children, especially the older child who attends therapy in the city of Veracruz, which is a couple of hours away from their community. This time her loan will be invested in the purchase of meat, vegetables, tortillas, oil, soft drinks, and gas, so she is able to continue selling Monday through Sunday from 4 pm until midnight. "I'm glad and happy for the large family that I have, for my children, who I will do everything for, and the taco stand for yielding the desired results. Next I will buy more tables and chairs to expand the business."

*The photograph was taken at Brenda’s taqueria. She, is wearing a white blouse and black cropped pants.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, tortillas, oil, drinks, and gas.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Мухаммад счастливый отец и ответственный муж и сын. Мухаммад вместе с семьей проживает на маленьком районе под названием Кубадиён. Мухаммад фермер с большой буквы. Ему всего 34 года. Он знает свою работу очень хорошо. В этом году он решил посеять пшеницу, овес и орехи. Он как расчетливый человек все посчитал и ему не хватает не большой суммы денег на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян. Но он не может отменить или сократить объем урожая. Поэтому ему остается только обратиться за кредитом. Он уверен, что выбрал верный путь и его на пути поддержат.
texts.en:
Muhammad is a happy father and responsible husband and son. He lives in the small region called Qubadiyon together with his family. Muhammad is a proper farmer. He is 34 years old. He knows his work very well. 

This year Muhammad decided to sow wheat, oats and nuts. He is a prudent man, and when he thought through everything he understood that he lacks a small sum of money to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds. However, he is not able to change or reduce the amount of crop. Therefore he was left only with the option to apply for a loan. 

Muhammad is confident that he has chosen the right path and that you will support him on his way.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rihuya

texts.ru: Рухия 54 летняя жительница славного района под названием Кубадиён. Кубадиён находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана и является одним из самых теплых мест Республики. Рухия очень добрая бабушка. Она вместе с внуками сыном и невесткой живет под одной крышей. Муж Рухии уже много лет находится за границей. Рухия любит проводить время вместе с внуками, но не забывает про свою работу. Она дехканка. Каждый год она не пропускает посев, и этот год не стал исключением. В этом году она собирается посадить пшеницу. Для посева ей надобны минеральные удобрения и пшеница. Но так как ее капитал не позволяет ей самостоятельно совершить покупку, Рухия обратилась за заемными средствами, надеясь на поддержку.
texts.en:
Rihuya is a 54 years old resident of the nice region named Qubadiyon. Qubadiyon is in the south-western part of Tajikistan and is one of the warmest places in the republic. Rihuya is a good grandmother. She lives under the same roof as her son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Rihuya's husband has been abroad for many years. 

Rihuya loves to spend her time together with her grandchildren, but does not forget about her job. She is a dekhan farmer. She never misses the sowing, and this year was no exception. This year she decided to sow wheat. To do this she needs mineral fertilizers and wheat. However as her financial resources do not allow her to complete the purchase alone, she applied for a loan, hoping for support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase certified seed, fertilizer and herbicide to spray the crops and enable her to harvest more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Emperatriz

texts.es:
Xiomara de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta  noveno grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos pero eso no es impedimento para ella para mandarlos a la escuela a que se preparen.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y también cuida ganado, ya tiene 8 años en estas actividades, la razón por la cual ella decidió dedicarse a esto fue porque le gusta mucho cuidar animales, sus trabajos los realiza en casa y un sobrino suyo se involucra.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar vacas y terneros y para comprar insumos agrícolas.
 
Ella espera prosperar en su trabajo para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 33 years old, studied until ninth grade, and is a single mother of two children, but that will not prevent her from sending them to school to get educated.

She makes a living raising chickens and breeding livestock, which she has done for 8 years already. She decided to do this work because she really likes taking care of animals. She works at home and her nephew helps her.

Xiomara is requesting this loan to buy cows and calves and to buy agricultural materials.
 
She hopes that her business thrives so that she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy cows, calves, and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Zeliha

texts.en:
Zeliha is married and a mother of three.  After her children grew up, she started making dowries from home.  She started getting lots of orders so she opened a shop and sold her products.  She had to close her shop because of the economic crisis and continued to work from home and sell her products either from home or from stands.  With the help of microcredits, she purchased materials for her products and developed her business.  With the help of her fourth loan, she is planning to buy more materials for her dowries, sell them at stands and develop her business. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeliha hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Çocukları büyüdükten sonra çeyiz işi ile uğraşmaya başladı.  Evden siparişler almaya başladı.  İşleri iyi gitmeye başlayınca dükkan açtı ve uzun yıllar dükkandan yaptı.  Ekonomik kriz yaşayınca dükkanı kapattı.  Evden ve tezgahtan satış yapmaya başladı.  Mikro kredi kullanmaya başladı.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile çeyiz malzemeleri aldı ve işini geliştirdi.  Şimdi dördüncü mikro kredisini kullanıyor ve malzeme alarak üretip 
stantlarda satacak işini geliştirecek.

loans.use: to buy dowry materials

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Perseverancia está integrado por once mujeres cuyo distintivo es el trabajo arduo, la responsabilidad, la honestidad y por supuesto la cualidad que llevan por nombre cuyo significado es la capacidad de seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades y los obstáculos. Una persona perseverante persigue sus objetivos con tesón, es dedicada, acaba lo que ha comenzado, se mantiene concentrada y trabaja en su tarea con constancia; y si fracasa vuelve a intentarlo mejorando el método. 
   Las integrantes del grupo son: Gregoria y Rosa quienes venden abarrotes; Reyna, tacos; Nayeli, comida y repostería; Cornelia y Ricarda, dulces; Jessica, bisutería y ropa; Lucia, artículos de plata; Marta, tortillas y masa. Por su parte Ma. de Lourdes maneja una repostería y Margarita, una refaccionaria. 
   “Cuando era niña aprendí de mi madre a realizar tortillas a mano, pues debía preparar el refrigerio a mi padre y hermanos, comencé sin pensar que se convertiría en mi actividad” explica Doña Marta quien ahora tiene veintidós años de experiencia. Desde hace diez años, Marta llegó a vivir a Veracruz y de inmediato acondicionó un pequeño espacio sólo bajo una lona de plástico en donde diario ofrecía las tradicionales tortillas. Actualmente, de lunes a domingo desde las  6:00 am  comienza a moler la masa para,  posteriormente, iniciar la elaboración de las tortillas o “picaditas”. Vende en promedio hasta 500 tortillas diarias y un mínimo de 25 kilos de masa. “Hay días en los que llego más temprano al local porque hay clientes que me encargan de 30 a 50 picaditas, y debo cumplir con cada uno de ellos". 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo Jorge en de la educación de sus tres hijos y con los gastos de la casa. Aunado a eso pudo comprar un molino eléctrico, un refrigerador para su casa y remodeló el lugar donde vende; hoy cuenta con paredes de lámina, un mostrador de concreto, una mesa, una prensa, el fogón y el elemento principal: la leña. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz y leña, esta vez su esposo sembrará maíz en el patio trasero de su casa para incrementar las ganancias de la actividad. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el espacio donde doña Martha elabora las tortillas, viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
The "Perseverancia" group is made up of eleven women who's distinction is their hard work , responsibility, honesty and of course the quality that the group is named for "Perseverance". It signifies the capacity to move ahead in spite of difficulties and obstacles. A persevering person consistently pursues with tenacity, dedication, finishes what they started, maintains their concentration and works at their task with steadfastness. if they fail they try to improve their method.

The members of the group are: Gregoria and Rosa who sell groceries; Reyna, tacos; Nayeli, meals and desserts; Cornelia and Ricarda, candies; Jessica, jewellery and clothing; Lucia, silver items; Marta, tortillas and dough for tortillas. Lourdes manages a pastry shop and Margarita, a repair shop.

"When I was a child my mother made tortillas by hand as she had to prepare the meals for my father and siblings. I start what became my business without thinking' Marta explained who now has 20 years of experience. Ten years ago Marta came to live in Veracruz and immediately fixed up a small space under a plastic sheet where she offers her traditional tortillas daily.

Currently from Monday to Sunday she starts to mix her dough at 6 am and then starts to make her tortillas. She sells about 500 tortillas daily and a minimum of 25 kilos of dough. "There are days when I go to my stand early as clients order 30 to 50 tortillas and I have to fill each order".

With her profits she helps her husband Jorge with the education of her three children and the household expenses. in addition to this she also bought an electric mill, a refrigerator for her house and remodeled her sales space. Today it has laminated sheeting for walls a concrete counter, a table, a press, the oven and the principal ingredient, wood.

She will invest the loan buying corn and wood. this time her husband will plant corn in the patio behind their house to increase the profits of her business. The photograph was taken in the space where Martha makes the tortillas. She is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en: Mayada is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She has been operating a bakery since 2007 in order to help her brother who is the main income provider in the family. She is a very hard worker and aims to improve her work and develop her lifestyle. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new merchandise for her business such as oil and flour to increase productivity and enhance her income. She would like to earn a greater income and she believes that the loan will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business such as oil and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another butchery in the area to meet the demands of his customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell to cocoa companies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are school-age.  

He works tirelessly to be able to satisfy his family requirements and always improve their lifestyle.  He works as a farmer and has been in this business for the past six years. 

Today, with his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will buy seeds and seedlings for plantings for his business in order to increase his income. 

He is well-known in his town for his good reputation.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for plantings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Dürdane

texts.en:
Dürdane is married and a mother of two.  After her children grew up, she had an economic crisis.  She started knitting at home and sold her knitted items.  She wanted to get a loan.  With the help of her first loan, she bought yarn for her knitting. First, she sold them to her neighbours, then she sold them on stands.  Now she is planning to get her fourth loan. She is planning to buy yarn for her products and develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Dürdane hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Çocukları büyüdükten sonra ekonomik krize girmiş.  Evde örgü örerek satmaya başlamış.  Mikro krediden faydalanmak istemiş.  İlk aldığı kredi ile örgü ipleri almış üretmiş ve satmış.  Önce çevresine satmaya başlamış, sonra stantlara çıkmaya başlamış.  Şimdi dördüncü kredisini alarak örgü ipi alıyor ve Örgü ören kadınlardan bebe hırkası ve yelekleri de alarak diğer kadınlara da yardımcı oluyor ve satışlarını artırarak işini geliştirmeye çalışıyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarn

loans.name: Armais

texts.en:
Armais, who is 25 years old, lives in the village of Giulbakhi. He has pensioner parents and they earn a living with agricultural activities. They are engaged in cattle and sheep breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivating family-owned land where they harvest beans. The family members get income from selling agricultural products at the local market. To make the business more profitable and increase the number of sales, Armais wants to purchase a car and start trading in other villages. The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,600 GEL for purchasing a secondhand car. 

Armais will sell the products door-to-door and will get more income. The loan will help him to add his bit to the family's welfare and increase the living condition of the family.
 
This hardworking and motivated man awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start trading trhough the region

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of two.  

After her husband got ill, she started working from home in order to earn money.  She is knitting and selling from home.  

With her second loan, she bought thread for her knitting and ready-made baby products and sold them.  With the help of her third loan, she is planning to buy more thread and baby products, and she will develop her business and earn more.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi hastalandıktan sonra çalışmaya başlıyor.  Evde örgü örüyor ve evden tanıdıklarına satış yapıyor.  İlk çektiği mikro kredi ile örgü ipleri alıyor üretiyor  ve stantlara çıkmaya başlıyor satışlarını artırıyor.  İkinci mikro kredi ile de bir miktar örgü ipi alıyor, bir miktarda hazır bebek ürünleri alarak satarak para kazanıyor.  Üçüncü çektiği mikro kredi ile örgü ipi ve hazır bebek ürünleri alarak İşini geliştirmek ve para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more thread and baby products

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of four. She is selling lingerie from home or from bazaars.

With her first loan, she bought lingerie, sold it and made money. With the help of her second loan, she is planning to buy more lingerie, sell it and earn money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Çamaşır satışı yapıyor evden ve pazarlarda satıyor. İlk çektiği mikro kredi ile çamaşır aldı sattı ve aile ekonomisine katkı sağladı. İkinci çektiği mikro kredi ile çamaşır alarak ve satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more lingerie.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 35 years old. She is divorced and has two kids. She is a doctor, and she needs a loan to pay for an upgrade medical course.

Gabriela would like to have her own office in the future. She is the only one who supports her family. Right now she is working for the government, but her salary is very low. That is why she needs the upgrade medical course, which will give her the chance to ask for a raise or to go to another place to work.

loans.use: to pay for an upgrade medical course.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 54-year-old widow living with her three children, one of whom is still at the university. She is a housewife and her oldest children cooperate together to satisfy the family's needs and live in a good lifestyle. Today, in order to pay her daughter's university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied, as she is able to pay her daughter's university fees and enable her to pursue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university fees

loans.name: Lourdes Celia

texts.es:
La socia Lourdes Celia pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua  trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua trabajando en el área de cocina ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Lourdes Celia is a member who belongs to the "Good Hope" Communal Bank, located in the district and department of Cusco, She continues to work in a private enterprise in the kitchen area. 

Lourdes is a responsible and enterprising person, and this is how she advances her family.

Lourdes is grateful for the past loan she received and promises to continue complying with her schedule of payments. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries such as rice, cooking oil, and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, cooking oil, and milk to re-stock her store.

loans.name: Iris Agustina

texts.es:
La socia Iris Agustina pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de  belleza, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias, perfumes para varones.
texts.en: Iris Agustina is a member of the Buena Esperanza [Good Hope] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province. The member continues with her business selling beauty products. She is grateful for the loan given and promises to make the agreed repayments. The member continues to sell creams, perfumes and colognes, among other things. She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she provides for her family. The member is applying for the loan to buy cologne, fragrances for men.

loans.use: to buy cologne, fragrances for men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bull for slaughter to meet her clients' needs for meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts, new tires and tubes to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

loans.name: Zurabi

texts.en:
Zurabi, a 53-year-old married man, is from the village of Argveta. He has pensioner parents as well as a wife, son, and daughter. His children are employed and have fixed salaries. 

Zurabi also works at the private factory and gets 400 GEL monthly. To satisfy the family's increased needs, the family members also engage in cattle breeding and in cultivating a family-owned vineyard. 

Zurabi searched for credit among local financial institutions and, after several unsuccessful attempts, his loan request was approved within the startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo—an initiative that enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting a business. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for building a greenhouse. Zurabi will purchase all the needed equipment and will start cultivating vegetables and greens, mostly. He will sell harvested products at a good price to the local market. 

Zurabi and his family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support, as the income of the family will significantly increase, thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse and expand the agribusiness

loans.name: Javlon

texts.ru: Чавлон очень рада на Вашу поддержку. Она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Чавлон веселая, жизнерадостная и миролюбивая женщина. Ее отец был трудолюбивым и честным дехканам, и Чавлон сейчас решила, идет по его стопа, чтобы сохранить деятельность отца. Она знает, что земледелие требует не малый труд. Чавлон начала свой новый бизнес по посеву лук, картофель, морковь и другие овощи. И посей день, ее бизнес существует и процветает. Чавлон просит финансирование для развития своего бизнеса. Она хочет приобрести семян урожай и минеральных удобрений.  Чавлон с надеждой смотрит вперед в будущее, и видит там богатый урожай и смело идет к своей мечте.
texts.en: Javlon is very happy with Your support. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Javlon is a cheerful, happy and peace-loving woman. Her father was a hardworking and honest farmer, and Javlon now decided to follow in his footsteps in order to save her father's business. She knows that farming needs a lot of work. Javlon started her new business by planting onions, potatoes, carrots and other vegetables. To-this day, her business exists and prospers. Javlon is requesting financing to develop her business. She wants to buy crop seeds and mineral fertilizers. Javlon looks toward the future with optimism, envisioning a rich harvest there, and, thus, bravely approaches her dream.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and a mother of four. She is making a contribution to the family budget by selling lingerie and knitting. She used microcredit two times and purchased yarn and lingerie. She gained money with them.

With the help of her third loan, she is planning to buy more yarn and lingerie. Zeynep is very happy to see that she is easily helping her children with their needs.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Zeynep hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Çamaşır satışı ve örgü örerek aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. İki kez mikro kredi kullandı ve kullandığı kredi ile çamaşır ve örgü ipi aldı, üretti ve satarak para kazandı. Üçüncü mikro kredi ile çamaşır alacak ve örgü ipi alacak üretip satarak para kazanmak istiyor. Aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more yarn and lingerie.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
From the village of Kveda Sakara, Paata is 45 years and resides with his pensioner father; they earn a living from small agricultural activities. Paata is engaged in cattle breeding and harvesting of nuts, selling his products at the local market. 

As the income is mostly seasonal, Paata decided to request financial support and start a more stable additional enterprise. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

With the loan, Paata plans to purchase the equipment and tools needed to open a car-wash service which he will operate. The loan will enable Paata to improve his economic situation and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To open car-wash service

loans.name: Nyakweyalira Group

texts.en:
Oliver, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a 29-year-old, hardworking woman, dealing in cocoa buying and selling. 

She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She has a cocoa garden where she gets additional income. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business.  

Oliver has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell to her customers. She is a member of Nyakweyalira group, whose members give guarantorship  to one another to get loans.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria de 39 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Gregoria se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su esposo es quien provee la mayor fuente de ingresos al hogar con su trabajo, de modo que ambos luchan por sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella desea iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa, es por ello que solicita este crédito, para comprar blusas, camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, etc. para venderla.


El sueño de Gregoria es ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas exitosas y educadas.
texts.en: Gregoria is 39 years old and only studied up to Grade 2. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She has two children who are studying. Gregoria works doing housework. It is her husband who provides most of the income for the household with his work, so both of them are fighting to raise their children. She wants to start a business selling clothing so she is requesting a loan to buy blouses, t-shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, etc to sell. Gregoria's dream is to see her children become successful and educated people.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sr. De Qoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE QOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angela ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de leña,negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "SR. DE QOYLLORITY” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis, Department of Cusco. 

The [featured] member is Angela. She is 42 years old and married, with 8 children. She works in animal sales and raises guinea pigs and hens.  Through her work activity she wishes to open a grocery store which is something she always dreamed of.  She also wants to expand her current location to accommodate more animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy more guinea pigs and hens, as well as animal feed.

The members in the attached photo to the group photo requested permission to be absent for work reasons, thus their photo was taken later.

The borrower is grateful to those who contribute to making this dream possible, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags for her business

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha de 31 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es policía, tiene tres hijos menores de edad que asisten la escuela.


Desde hace varios años, Bertha se ha dedicado a vender miel de abeja la cual traen de otra ciudad, se ha dedicado a esta actividad con el ánimo de obtener algún ingreso económico para el hogar.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar miel de abeja al por mayor y luego venderla.

Ella sueña con mantener su negocio y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en: Bertha is 31 years old and she graduated from Secondary school. She is in a relationship and her partner is a police agent. She has three children who attend school. For a number of years Bertha has worked selling bee's honey which she brings from another city. She works in this business with the idea of obtaining some economic income for the household. She is requesting a loan to buy honey wholesale to later resell. She dreams of keeping up her business so that her children lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy bee's honey wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Lungi Group

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Massah. She is married with two children. Her children are both school-going. Massah belongs to a solidarity group of four, three women and one man, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Lungi” is the name of Massah’s solidarity group.

Lungi Group needs a total loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Massah will receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase two bags of sugar, three cartons of tea, coffee, and two dozens tins of Peak milk for her business. (See group picture: Massah is on the far left with the white head-tie).

Massah established her provisions business four years ago. She established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Massah uses the profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. Massah is a hardworking woman. She opens her business from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday every week.

In the future, Massah plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of sugar, three cartons of tea, coffee, and two dozen tins of Peak milk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hard-working, 49-year-old mother of four children and a resident of Lubaya, Kashozi. She has a banana plantation in lubaya, Mbarara. 
She also has a goat business where she is earning good money which has educated her children. Her husband works in the city. Rose is educating her children using her agriculture income. Rose has been with UGAFODE for about four years and has now requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more goats to raise and later sell. She has enough vacant farmland for goats and hopes to earn more from her business. 
She appreciates the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Las Solidarias Chucam Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango, or “Chichi” is well-known for its market days held twice a week where one can find a huge quantity of handicrafts, traditional textiles, as well as animals, medicinal plants and traditional copal incense. The market is large, colorful and noisy and draws tourists from all parts of the world. The majority of the population is Maya-Quiche.

Eight women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank (“Las Solidarias Chuacam”) and work hard each day to realize their goals, dreams and to meet the daily needs of their families. The ladies are on their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Elsa, who is 27 years old, is a single mother with a beautiful son who is nearly 4 years old. She is the treasurer of the Trust Bank. Elsa has three business endeavors that include the fabrication of the pretty “huipiles” or traditional blouses, clothes washing business and a house cleaning business. She has requested her second loan from Friendship Bridge to purchase more fabric as her “huipiles” enjoy great demand. She wants to be certain to have plenty of inventory available for her customers.

Elsa and the ladies in the group meet each month to transact business on their loans. They also participate in educational training given by a Friendship Bridge facilitator on a variety of relevant subjects. Using role playing, stories and pictures, the facilitator shares information with the group in their native language of Quiche. 

Friendship Bridge is rooted in the belief that when offered microloans, education and encouragement, women get the helping hands they desire to make a better life for themselves, their families and their communities. In funding loans, Kiva investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in helping Elsa and her friends realize their goals and dreams. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase more fabric as her “huipiles” enjoy great demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and pesticides

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a hard-working man from rural western Uganda. He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy manure to spread on his banana plantation. He believes with the input, the yields will increase and so will the sales and income. Benson has had his banana plantation for nine years and it has been his major source of income. Benson has managed to open a retail shop which his wife operates to generate supplemental income. Benson has a dream of expanding his plantation and getting the best banana yields in his village. He appreciates the support of UGAFODE and Kiva.

loans.use: to obtain manure for his banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and pay laborers on her plantation

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio Hernan pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  continua  trabajando en una agencia de viajes, el socio  se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de paquetes turísticos, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos entre otros.
texts.en: Hernan belongs to the BUENA ESPERANZA communal bank. It is located in the district of Cusco and the department of Cusco. He continues to work in his travel agency. He is grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments. He is a responsible and diligent person. He continues to sell different kinds of tourist packets this being the way he gets his family ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy tourist tickets amongst others.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets amongst others.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехре 58 лет. Она замужем за простого фермера. Гулчехра вместе пережили много бед и радостных событий вместе и воспитали четверых детей. Гулчехра помогает мужу в посеве и сборе урожая. А ее муж помогает ей в работе в скотном дворе. Вот так с поддержкой друг друга они живут много лет. У семьи Гулчехры финансовое положение не самое лучшее и чтобы вернуть стабильность Гулчехра планирует расширить животноводческую деятельность путем увеличения поголовья скотов. А ее муж уже начать посев урожая. Гулчехра надеется, что ее семью поддержат и их финансовое положение стабилизуется.
texts.en: Gulchehra is 58 years old. She is married to an ordinary farmer. Gulchehra and her husband lived through many troubles and joyful events together and raised four children. Gulchehra helps her husband with sowing and gathering the harvest. And her husband helps her at the livestock yard. This is how they have been living together with each other's support for many years. Gulchehra's family is not in the best financial situation, and, to return stability, Gulchehra plans to expand her animal husbandry business by increasing her livestock headcount. Her husband is already starting to plant the crops. Gulchehra hopes that her family will be supported, and their financial situation will stabilize.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 31 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Samina has taken out a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy new tires with spare auto parts for her husband's vehicle so he can provide better transportation services to his passengers.

loans.name: Liset

texts.en: Liset is 24 years old and she is mother of 3 children. Liset earns money by selling fried fish and she needs a loan to buy fish. Liset is the only person that earns money at her house; that is why she needs your help. Liset is married, but she has troubles in her marriage and her husband is not working. She hopes you can help her because she is a good cook and she knows where to buy the best fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 42 years old. He is a carpenter and he makes coffins. David works very hard; he learned about his business when he was a kid. David needs a loan to buy wood. David has a son and he and his girlfriend are living together at his parents house. David hopes you can help him because his girlfriend is unemployed, and his parents are retired.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank “KUSIKOYLLOR”. This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province in the Cusco department.

One of the members is Erika. She is partnered, 34 years old, and has 3 children. She works in her artisanal business. She sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells different fabrics. She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her fabric and loom sales business. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters, and looms.

The member who appears in the accompanying photo asked permission due to work reasons, thus the photo was taken after the meeting.

The other members work in businesses such as clothing sales, brick sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.

Erika is thankful to those who take part in her dream through this medium, and she promises to make her scheduled payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an additional bag of dry pepper, two bags of garden eggs.and two bags of okra for her business.

loans.name: Sucam Smart Ladies Group

texts.en: Sucam Smart Ladies is a group of young single mothers between the ages of 15 to 25 years. They were selected to engage in a training and empowerment program on reproductive health and gender equality. Junior Achievement Kenya also provided training in entrepreneurship and financial literacy for the ladies. During the training some of the ladies started businesses of selling vegetables, cosmetic products and plastic products. The group has been working together in providing moral support both socially and economically. All group members successfully graduated from the Junior Achievement Entrepreneurship Program and are looking forward to setting up a business to sell sardines. The loan will support their business and eventually drive each individual to save enough to begin their individual enterprises.

loans.use: to buy and sell sardines (small dried fish)

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina  ella es casada y tiene 60 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.


Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron  permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank “Reyna del Carmen”. This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province in the Cusco department.

One of the members is Justina. She is married, 60 years old, and has 4 children. She works in her grocery store. She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. She has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The members who are pasted into the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting, because they requested to do so for work reasons. 

The other members work in businesses such as clothing sales, brick sales, grocery stores, and restaurants. 

Justina is thankful to those who take part in her dream through this medium, and she promises to make her scheduled payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Arturo Modesto

texts.en: Arturo is 49 years old, has been married for 26 years and has lived in the same house for more than 40 years. He works for the state government,. providing maintenance to public parks. Arturo is asking for a loan to finish putting a ceiling in one of the rooms of his house. He needs the money to complete the work.

loans.use: To pay for home improvements such as finishing a room ceiling.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia Encarnación pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; la socia continua dedicándose a elaborar tejidos y trabajando como empleada del hogar, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete acumñp.lir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lana de diferentes colores ,hilos,agujas entre otros.
texts.en:
Member Encarnación belongs to the "Comuzone III" communal bank. She continues to make a living by knitting and working as a housemaid. Encarnación feels grateful by the loan granted to her and commits to honour her set installments.

The member is a responsible and dedicated person, this being the way that she keeps her family going. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of wool of different colors, thread, needles, among others.

loans.use: to buy wool of different colors, thread, needles, among others.

loans.name: Ilucion Group

texts.es:
El Estado de Veracruz es conocido por su actividad ganadera y agrícola y la comunidad de donde es originario el grupo Ilucion desempeña ambas. Los integrantes del grupo son: Loida y Benita quienes venden abarrotes; Claudia, fruta; Guadalupe, repostería y cosméticos; Reyna, bisutería; María, refrescos y queso; Santa y Crisitian, ropa y bisutería. Mientras que Gabriel repara electrodomésticos y Filiberto maneja un taxi. 
   Santa ha formado una familia con su esposo Ángel y sus dos hijos a quienes intenta ofrecer las mejores oportunidades. Los padres de Santa son comerciantes que se han dedicado durante años a vender ropa en diferentes comunidades y establecimientos.  Ángel también es vendedor ambulante y fue así como la pareja se conoció.
