Después de haber sufrido una parálisis, Santa decidió iniciar con un negocio propio; así nació su tienda de ropa en donde además vende accesorios, pulseras, aretes, relojes, gafas, diademas, anillos y cinturones. Exhibe la mercancía en maniquís y ganchos, y cuenta con una extensa variedad para toda la familia. Los días jueves los emplea para comprar más mercancía y para no tener pérdidas decidió contratar a una joven que se encarga del local mientras ella sale. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas paga el salario de su empleada, cubre el pago de la renta del local, apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y reinvierte en la compra de accesorios y ropa de moda. Santa ofrece facilidades de pago a sus clientes preferentes quienes le abonan constantemente de manera semanal o quincenal.
   El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para comprar pantalones, shorts, playeras y blusas ya que son las prendas de mayor demanda. Comenta con entusiasmo “obtener mis propios ingresos y ver sonreír a mis hijos es lo que más me motiva a continuar, superando cada uno de los obstáculos que me pone el destino”. 
   El grupo agradece a cada una de las personas que han creído en ellos al otorgarles un préstamo para favorecer su actividad.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la tienda de Doña Loida, Santa es quien viste playera blanca, en la foto aparecen también los hijos de Doña Claudia.
texts.en:
The state of Veracruz is known for agriculture and livestock. The people in the community where the Ilucion communal bank got its start engage in both activities. The members of the group are: Loida and Benita, who sell groceries; Claudia sells fruit; Guadalupe sells sweets and cosmetics; Reyna sells costume jewelry; Maria sells soft drinks and cheese; Santa and Cristian sell clothing and jewelry; Gabriel repairs home appliances, and Filberto drives a taxi. 

Santa has raised a family with her husband Angel. They have two children to whom she tries to offer the best opportunities. Santa's parents are merchants who over the years have sold clothing in different communities and establishments. Angel is also a roving salesman and that his how the couple met. 

After having suffered paralysis, Santa decided to start her own business, and that is how her clothing store got started. She also sells accessories, bracelets, earrings, clocks, glasses, headbands, rings, and belts. She displays her merchandise on mannequins and from hooks and she has an extensive variety for the entire family. On Thursdays she buys more merchandise and so that she doesn't lose business, she decided to hire a young woman to run the store for her while she's away. With her earnings she is able to cover her employee's wages, the rent for the store, and also help her husband with household expenses. Additionally, she is able to reinvest in her store by buying accessories and stylish clothing. Santa offers easy payment terms to her preferred customers who continually pay her either weekly or twice a month.

The loan that Santa is requesting will be used to buy pants, shorts, t-shirts, and blouses which are the items in greatest demand. She enthusiastically comments, "earning my own income and seeing my children smile is what motivates me the most to carry on, overcoming every obstacle that destiny puts in my path." 

The group thanks everyone who has believed in them by granting them loans for their businesses. 

*The photo was taken in front of Loida's store. Santa is the one in a white t-shirt. Claudia's children are also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Nabai Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Dauda suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm  yields

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio is 40 years old and owns a motorcycle taxi. He lives in his grandparents' house and is married. His wife works in a tortilla (Mexican corn bread) store. 

He is asking for a loan because there is an opportunity to acquire a second motorcycle taxi. He wants to expand and get additional income. He has  been working in transportation for more than 25 years. At the beginning he had a bicycle taxi, and then he acquired the motorcycle. His biggest accomplishment is supporting his family.

loans.use: To acquire a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Bamiyayi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  

This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno’s cleaning business began 11 years ago, providing daily service to restaurants and offices, as well as special floor work upon request. 

Originally from Brazil, he works long hours in order to support his wife and children. His greatest opportunity came when he acquired a contract to clean for a big company. Despite the heavy work he faced, he eagerly embraced the chance. 

This breakthrough has inspired him to grow the company, but in order to successfully hire new employees and increase the number of contracts he can manage, Bruno needs to buy improved equipment and will use this loan to do so.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his cleaning company

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón, tiene más de 2 años de experiencia en esa actividad, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentra, Ana vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She sells cashews for a living, and has two years of experience in this profession. She sells her products in the different markets that she finds. Ana lives in her own house with her family, and she is requesting a loan to buy more cashews seeds in high quantities to continue with her job; so that, she can improve the life conditions of her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
A husband, father of four children, and US military veteran, Alejandro currently works for the Department of Corrections.  However, his true passion is the landscaping business he started one year ago, A Kut Above Lawn Care. With scheduling and administration help from his wife and volunteer work from his oldest son, he has been able to secure four permanent clients.  

He started the business as a challenge to himself, as he is the only means of income for his family of six. Running the business is certainly stressful, but above all, the landscaping is a hobby he is excited to be pursuing.
	
Alejandro is currently limited in the amount and scope of service he can provide. He is motivated with each new client to continue to grow A Kut Above Lawn Care to its full potential with efficiency and quality. In the future, he envisions his business to be his main source of income. 

He is seeking ways to cut down on work time and increase productivity each day. This loan will allow him to purchase a larger trailer and a commercial mower.  Furthermore, he hopes to eventually have two or three crews of three employees, an essential step in ensuring growth and success.

loans.use: to purchase a larger trailer and a commercial mower for his landscaping business

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés de 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres solo le enseñaron a trabajar, está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene cinco hijos pero solo uno vive en casa pues los mayores son independientes.

Andrés se dedica a cultivar maíz desde que tenía 7 años, sus dos hermanos le enseñaron ya que su padre los
abandonó cuando estaban pequeños fue por eso que tuvieron que luchar para salir adelante solos con su madre.


Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono para la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, de esa manera lograra tener la cosecha y venderla en el mercado a buen precio.

Él sueña con  seguir cultivando la tierra y de esa manera tener alimentos para su familia y vender para sacarle ganancias.
texts.en:
Andrés is 50 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school. His parents only taught him how to work.  He is married and his wife is a housewife. They have five children but only one lives at home as the older ones are independent. 

Andres has worked at growing corn since he was seven years old. His two older brothers taught him how to do this as his father abandoned them when they were small. This is why they had to fight to get ahead by themselves, being raised by only their mother. 

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer for planting basic grains such as beans and corn so he will have a good crop which he can sell at a good price in the market. 

He dreams of continuing to cultivate the land to have food for his family, selling the excess to earn income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting basic grains such as beans and corn.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos secos y la venta de chicha, la socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, trigo entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC which is located in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. She continues her work selling dry products and chicha [a traditional beverage made from corn]. 

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time. She is a responsible and hard-working person and continues to sell her merchandise to all of her customers who ask her for it. This is how she is able to raise her family.

The member is asking for the loan so she can buy corn and wheat, among other things.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed such as nappier grass and hay for her dairy cow.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es: Victoria de 28 años, trabajó durante dos años en restaurantes, experiencia que le permitió empoderarse de todo el conocimiento para emprender su propio negocio; considero que  podía dejar de ser empleada y crear su microempresa, con sus ahorros compro un terreno y construyo un local donde actualmente funciona su restaurante.  Tiene dos colaboradores para lograr atender la demanda de clientes que en su gran mayoría son conductores de busetas, puesto que enfrente de su local se encuentra situada una cooperativa de conductores. Así mismo muchos de los residentes del barrio donde vive en el municipio de Barranquilla, todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 4:30 p.m. degustan de los deliciosos platillos que prepara, desayunos y almuerzos ejecutivos; carnes asadas, arroces, ensaladas y sopas.  Sus comprar las realiza a graneros ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla, donde consigue todos los productos necesarios para la preparación sus comidas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual utilizará en unas adecuaciones al local y en compra de materias primas; arroz, aceite, legumbre y demás.  Esta inversión mejorará las condiciones del restaurante con lo que se espera haya más afluencia de clientes.  Ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrecer bienestar, ella desea ampliar su negocio en pro de favorecer su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Victoria, who is 28 years old, worked for 2 years in restaurants, and the experience allowed her to obtain all the necessary knowledge to start her own business. She believed she could stop being an employee and started her micro-enterprise. With her savings, she bought a piece of land and built a venue in which she currently operates her restaurant.

She has two helpers so as to cope with the requests of customers, which are primarily minibus drivers due to a driver's cooperative being located in front of her venue. Likewise, every day from 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. many of the residents of the neighborhood in which she lives, located in the municipality of Barranquilla, enjoy the delicious meals she prepares, executive breakfasts and lunches, grilled meats, rices, salads, and soups. She purchases products in granaries located in downtown Barranquilla, where she manages to get all the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her meals.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she does with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and which she will use for improvements to her venue, and the purchase of supplies, such as rice, oil, legumes, among other things. This investment will improve the conditions of the restaurant, and she hopes this will increase the influx of customers. She is the mother of two underage children,to whom she wants to provide well-being. She wishes to expand her business so that she can strengthen her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to upgrade her venue and buy supplies such as rice, oil, legumes, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Delia Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS DE AMAYBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Delia Dominga  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café y cacao, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Delia belongs to the communal bank "The Palm Trees of Amaybamba."  The bank is located in the district of Huayopata, which belongs to the province of La Convención in the Department of Cusco, Perú.  

Delia works in agriculture.  She has a plot where she grows coffee and cacao.  She is a hard-working woman who through her work wants to get ahead and help her family progress.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Delia is happy for Kiva's support and promises to comply with the repayment plan for her loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel de 55 años de edad, casado con tres hijos mayores de edad, originario de Managua, de los cuales uno de los hijos estudia en la universidad ingeniería en sistema los otros ya trabajan y tiene su propia familia. Este hombre se ha caracterizado por ser  trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad sigue luchando para sacar adelante a su familia, y seguir ayudándole a sus hijo para que cumpla sus sueños y metas como verlo formado en su profesional, para que tenga un mejor futuro.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  Juan Manuel tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, fósforos, detergentes, frescos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas etc. El dedica unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para mantener su clientela y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juan Manuel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 55 years of age, is a native of Managua.  He is married with three adult children, of which one studies system engineering at university and the others work and have their own families. This man has been characterized by being hard-working, responsible, with willingness of self-improvement. Currently, he still is struggling to raise his family, and still help his son to fulfill his dreams and goals as a trained professional, so he has a better future.
 Thanks to his desire to succeed, Juan Manuel earns a living in a grocery store. It's a small store that sells edible products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergents, fresh, juice, soda, cookies etc. He spends about twelve hours daily selling his goods to keep his customers and in the not too distant future get better income. Juan Manuel appreciates the assistance that KIVA investors offer to people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in his grocery store in products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergents, soft drinks, juice, sodas, cookies etc.

loans.name: Leopord

texts.en:
Leopord is 46 years old. He is married with six children aged between 6 and 28 years old. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 15 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a motorcycle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA représente le groupe ESPOIR. MOUSSA est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le 01an 06mois. 01 va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il est gérant d'une boutique depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de son quartier. 
Mr veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz, 02bidons d'huile et 02cartons de spaghetti pour sa boutique.
IL  désire réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle  et mieux entretenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa represents the group called Espoir (Hope). Moussa is married and the father of two children. The older is six years old and the younger  is a year and a half. One of them attends school.  

Moussa is responsible for four persons. He has been managing a shop for five years. He buys his inventory in the market in his neighborhood. 

Moussa wants to buy two sacks of rice, two tins of oil, and two cases of spaghetti for his shop. He wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to buy a plot of land and better support his family.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, two tins of oil, and two cases of spaghetti for his shop

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis de 36 años de edad, no estudió debido a que sus padres no podían darle el estudio por sus recursos económicos, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y también es ayudante de albañil, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno vive en casa y está estudiando noveno grado en la escuela.


Gladis tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas y matates, lo aprendió de su madre quien todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a la misma actividad, sus hijos le ayudan a Gladis en este trabajo siempre que pueden. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar pollos de engorde y venderlos a buen precio, le servirá de mucho pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos económicos.

El sueño de Gladis es tener una granja de pollos muy  grande y tener siempre los ingresos para ayudarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is 36 years old and never studied because her parents didn't have the money to send her to school. She has a life partner who is a farmer as well as an assistant bricklayer. They have five children, only one of whom lives at home and is in the 9th grade in school. 

For many years Gladis has made hammocks and matates [loosely woven, stretchy bag] for many years. She learned this craft from her mother who engaged in this handicraft forever. Gladis's children help her with this work whenever they can.

The loan will be used to buy broiler chickens to be sold later at a good price. This will help her a lot because it will increase her income. 

Gladis dreams of having a very big chicken farm so she will always have the income she needs to help her family.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens to be sold later at a good price.

loans.name: Wendsongdo Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMADOU représente le groupe WENDSONGDO. Marié et père de 01 enfant. L'enfant est âgé de 05ans. Personne ne  va à l’école. Il a 03 personnes en charge.
Mr vend tissus et articles de mercerie depuis 06ans. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché.
Il veut s’acheter 01rouleau de dentèle et 02 rouleaux de tissus.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou represents the group called Wendsongdo. He is married and the father of one child. The child is five years old. No one attends school. Mr. Hamidou is responsible for three persons. He has been selling cloth and sewing notions for six years. He buys his supplies in the big market. He wants to buy one roll of lace and two rolls of cloth. 

Mr. Hamidou wants to use his profit to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy one roll of lace and two rolls of cloth

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Daggu Village. 

Salisu joined Babban Gona so that he could grow his farm. Through Babban Gona’s input loan Salisu will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, increasing his household income significantly. 

With Babban Gona's support, Salisu has ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year. With increased yields and incomes, he would like to acquire more land to put in the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Dalladi

texts.en:
Dalladi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gangarida Village. Dalladi joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dalladi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.

This season, Dalladi has grand plans to harvest 40 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dalladi now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a single parent with three children, between the ages of three and twenty six years. She sells sachet water for a living and has been in the sachet water business for 10 years now. 

Looking at the area where she lives, most people do not have refrigerators, so she buys and sells chilled sachet water for them. She wants to make more profit in order to cater for her children, especially their education. 

She will use this loan to buy more water and sell it to maximize her profit and take proper care of her children.

loans.use: to buy more sachets of water to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is James. He is 50 years old and blessed with 6 children. 3 of his children are in primary school while the other 3 are in secondary school. He is married and lives with his family. 

James is a maize, bean, and tomato farmer. He received training in enterprise development and financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise. 

James is taking a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, in order to improve his business. He hopes the Kiva loan will boost his business and improve his family's standard of living, including both their quality of education and healthcare. 

James is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make regular payments.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost crop yield and give a bounty harvest.

loans.name: Wendano Wa Ndiwa Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ndungululu; a member of a group called Wendano Wa Ndiwa. She is 65 years old, a widow, and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training and especially on enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming and is borrowing Kiva loan to buy poultry chicks so as to add stock to her poultry farming for increased income. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry chicks so as to add stock to her poultry farming for increased income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Bashy est le Monsieur qui a la daba à l’épaule. 
Bashy est un cultivateur malien âgé de 30 ans. Il vit dans une commune rurale du mali avec sa famille. Marié, et père de deux (02) enfants âgées de 6 mois a 3 ans ; la femme de Bashy fait la culture d’arachide pour gagner sa vie. 
Bachy n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, néanmoins son activité génératrice de revenu est basée sur la culture de l’arachide. Son rêve est d’avoir un jour les moyens pour bien s’occuper de ses enfants et mener autres  activité qui n’est pas saisonnier, c’est pourquoi Bashy  fait  recourt au prêt du RMCR.
Avec le prêt il achètera plus de semence d’arachide (200 kg) et de l’engrais chimique  (2 sacs).
Il prévoit un bénéfice de 500.000 FCFA durant les 7 mois du prêt si toute fois il pleut abondamment.
texts.en:
Bashy is the one with the adz on his shoulder [in the photo]. He is a farmer in Mali, and he is 30 years old. He lives in a rural area with his family. He is married and is the father of two children, aged six months and three years old. His wife is also a farmer who grows groundnuts to earn a living. 

Bachy did not have a chance to go to school, however he earns a living by farming groundnuts. His dream is to have one day the means to take good care of his children and to have non-seasonal work. It is for this reason that Bashy has asked for a loan through RMCR. 

With this loan, Bashy is going to buy more groundnut seeds (200 kilograms) and chemical fertilizer (two sacs). 

He hopes to earn a profit of 500,000 francs CFA during the seven months of the loan if it rains enough.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ibrahim suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Seu

texts.en: Seu is a 46-year-old mother with seven children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Seu requested a loan to buy bread, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy bread, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a clever man. He was born in Baku  in 1995 . He is a student at university and is well known among friends and students. Farid is single and lives with his parents. His family did not have money for the education of their son, but they wanted to educate him. 

For this reason Farid  asking for a loan to pay his tuition fee for university. He awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness. His is going to finish his education and find a good job to help his family live better. Please support him.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for university

loans.name: Vanda

texts.en:
Vanda (in photo) is 42 years old, lives at Dongkor district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has married since 1994. He has one son and one daughter. They are attending school.
 
Vanda has been a construction worker for 8 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for one year. He would like to apply loan to make the gate around his house.
Nowadays, He hasn’t the gate around his house , he wants to get the gate to protect for safety

loans.use: To make the gate around his house.

loans.name: Salomidin

texts.ru: Саломидин 26 лет. Он из района Чиликул. Саломидин отец и женатый мужчина. Его родители были дехканами, и он тоже унаследовал их профессию. Саломидин большую часть своей жизни провел, работая на земле. Он занимается земледелием. Недавно он приобрел поле, где еще ранее ничего не посеялось. Саломидин хочет обработать землю и посадить картофель. По этой причине ему нужны картофельные семена и минеральные удобрения для обработки землю. Чтобы их приобрести, у него нет денежных средств. Он очень хочет успеть посадить картофель во время.
texts.en: Salomidin is 26 years old. He is from the Jilikul district. Salomidin is a father and a married man. His parents were farmers, and he inherited their trade. Salomidin spent a large part of life working on the land. He is involved in farming. He recently bought a field that has never been planted before. Salomidin wants to cultivate this land and plant potatoes. This is why he needs potato seeds and mineral fertilizers to cultivate the land, but does not have enough money. He really wants to plant the potatoes in-time.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to cultivate the land

loans.name: Illocano 1 Group

texts.en:
Analyn is the featured borrower of Illocano 1 Group. She gathered the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's Field Partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon. Their work in Lebanon provides a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Analyn is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. She is trying hard to develop her living conditions, thus today, she is acquiring a loan to support her agricultural business in the Philippines through buying seeds. This loan is very important to Analyn for it will help her increase her family's income and improve their lives. She is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Mayzelyn is the first lady on the right, and Juliet is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to support her agricultural business in the Philippines through buying seeds

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. Ahmad appears in the photo. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Ahmad would like to improve his living conditions so he decided to start a new business. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to use to transfer goods. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to work more hours and increase his income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to use to transfer goods

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 29-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and 2 daughters in a small, humble house.

Ibrahim works in the public sector where the salaries are low and unstable. He has taken a USD murabaha-type loan from FATEN to buy a solar panel system. This will help him both provide hot water to his home and reduce electricity expenses. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en:
Faraj is a 46-year-old married man from Rafah City. He is a father of 7 daughters. 

Faraj earns a low income, which is not enough to cover all his family's needs. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy what they need, so he has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family home, which will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Faraj appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a single 41 year old Lebanese woman living alone. She has spent six years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing her revenues. Currently, Rima wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase cosmetic tools. She feels like she is meant to work in such a business and states that she is very happy and looks forward to opening her own beauty salon soon.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic tools

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 54-year-old married woman with no children who lives with her husband.  She has been working for two years from her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme, oil…  with the aim of helping her husband to meet the needs of life and to be able to live properly. Currently, Khadija is applying for a second loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to improve her business merchandise to serve her clients with the best products. She became an optimistic person after receiving Kiva's help. The new loan will surely help her to expand her business area. She hopes that, in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise

loans.name: Rosemand

texts.en: Rosemand is a 37 year old married woman living with her husband and six children. Her children attend school. She is a housewife and her husband is the main source of income for the family. Her husband owns a butcher shop. Due to the hard financial situation, Rosemand is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s school fees. Her purpose is to help them achieve higher educational levels.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and materials he will use in the preparation of hot drinks

loans.name: Amar

texts.en:
Amar is a 35-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She cooperates with her brother, who works in the Lebanese army, to fulfill her family's needs.

In 2005, she decided to open her own beauty salon in her town in order to take on some of the responsibilities with her brother. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate her beauty salon. This will increase her revenues.

In the future, she plans to expand her work more.

loans.use: to renovate her beauty salon.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita hails from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 52-years-old. She is married with two adult children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Isabelita owns a sari-sari store (convenience store) and a place where she sell vegetables like squash, okra, beans, cabbage, bottle gourd and christophine. Her business is doing well, however, she needs additional capital for her sari-sari store. 

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasoning, spices and meat. Her income will be used for family consumption, savings and reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasoning, spices and meat.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS DE AMAYBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Brigida se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café,mandarinas y cacao, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Brigida belongs to the communal bank "The Palm Trees of Amaybamba."  The bank is located in the district of Huayopata, and belongs to the province of La Convención and the Department of Cusco.  

Brigida works in agriculture.  She has a plot where she grows coffee, mandarin oranges, and cacao.  She is a hard-working woman who by means of this work wants to get ahead and help her family progress.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  

She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 30-year-old single woman from the community of Dalaguete, Cebu. Esterlita works hard to earn a living. She has been farming vegetables in her backyard. She plants chayote (christophine) and sponge gourd. 

She is asking a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer so she can cultivate more land and expand her farming. She hopes that with the loan from CEVI her plans will materialize and will help bring in more profits for her to save for the future and her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima goes fishing. She sells crab. She is 51s year old and a married woman with six eight children, aged 10-24 years old. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. Aside from that, she also engages in a mat weaving business. She weaves and sells mats. She lives  in Getafe, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like crab nets and materials for mat weaving.  In this way, she could now be able to balance her finances. With these, she could now provide healthy diets to the whole family.

She dreams to expand her business to make it productive and sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like crab nets and materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Melia

texts.en:
Clothing is indeed an unchangeable part of our lives. Due to this mere fact, Melia, 52, found a business for herself in the clothing industry. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Caloocan City, Philippines. Joel, her husband, helps her to provide for their family needs. As of now, she operates a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear products. Through this, she is able to gain a little profit, which she basically uses for primary expenditures within the household. 

Here, she buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells it retail to mostly people within her community. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing to other similar products like shoes and bags. Customers are attracted to buy due to favorable prices and the many options she is offering. 

With a humble heart, Melia would like to take a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales, and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to have more stalls for her business. She also desires for her children to be able to complete their studies and have their own house-and-lot someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is encouraged that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy for tire replacement and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda aims to buy additional tricycle units to serve more customers. She prays that God will prosper them through her transport business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora lives in Ozamiz City and supports her six children with good education.Elnora has been saving for house renovation. As a microfinance member of Paglaum, she availed various types of loans. Recently, she applied a loan  to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en:
Adulfa is 53 years old, married, and has 12 children to support. To earn a living she is engaged in a vending business as a source income for her family. She wants to increase her family’s income; that’s why she needs financial assistance to increase her grocery stall inventory and increase her sales. 

To do this, she decided again to borrow a loan to buy additional goods to sell. Her plan for the future is to save money out from her business to buy a lot of her own.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 28 years old, married and has 3 children to provide for.

To earn a living and help her husband, she is engaged in a piggery business. It was a good business for the family for 5 years and they get their daily needs from it.

Jovelyn still wants to give a more comfortable life to her children. She needs financial assistance to expand her piggery and make it more profitable. She borrowed a loan again to buy feeds for the piglets.

Jovelyn wants to expand her piggery business in the future to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the piglets

loans.name: Felino

texts.en:
His name is Felino 37, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Marites, a cashier, and has two children who are all in the Elementary Level. The couple work to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling. 

Felino operates a tricycle for six years already. His tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Silang, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited . Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of Php 600 a day. 

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a Php 8000 loan which he will use to pay for gas and maintenance of his tricycle. He is positive that this will boost his income as tricycle transportation is really a necessity in their place. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and the safe trips of his service. 

Felino aims to buy another unit of tricycle to serve the growing population in their town. He prays that God will prosper his business so he could send his children to college and see them become professionals someday. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for his tricycle maintenance for the benefit of his family

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 57 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sylvia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sylvia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and married with five children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Nersita

texts.en:
Nersita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a weaving bamboo (use for the walling of the house) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo for her weaving bamboo business.

Nersita has been in this business for 4 years. Nersita earns more income from general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Nersita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo for her bamboo weaving to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a charcoal retailing business.

Mercy dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 52 years old.

Arcele has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

Arcele has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to expand her business and pay school fees

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling pottery in the Philippines. She also earns income from food vending.  Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more pottery products in her pottery business.

Rebecca has sustained her business activities through a past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pottery products to sell

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives with his wife and his son’s family in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. 

Suren has been a farmer since a very young age, and now on his farm he has a cow, calves, pigs, heifers and chickens. As well as his farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs, Suren also sells potatoes. He also has an orchard from which he gathers apples, mulberries and apricots. 

As spring is a perfect period for potato cultivation, and as it generates good profits, Suren is seriously engaged in potato cultivation activities currently. 

He will use this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is 38 years old and lives in Dilijan. He graduated from Dilijan’s medical college but never managed to work in his specialty. Now he works as a driver for a private company.

Edvard is married and has two daughters, both of them school-aged. His wife used to work as a nurse at a local clinic, but now she is unemployed and she takes care of their house and children.

Lately, thanks to his savings Edvard was able to renovate his flat, making it more comfortable and clean. He is applying now for a 600,000 AMD loan through Kiva’s field partner Nor Horizon to buy guest-room furniture for his newly refurbished flat.

loans.use: to buy guest room furniture for his newly refurbished flat.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander de 31 años de edad, habita en un municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años. Allí tiene una tienda, donde vende ranchos, víveres, verduras, cárnicos etc. Su experiencia data de hace 5 años, cuando en el 2012, trabajó como empleado de una tienda y adquirió su experiencia que lo impulsó a  emprender de  manera independiente su propio negocio. Alexander ofrece sus productos en un local   de contado y también ofrece algunos créditos trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche; sus clientes son sus vecinos del barrio, quienes le compran a la medida de sus posibilidades al detalle,  bienes de la canasta familiar, que consumen diariamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bebidas, arroz, cárnicos, lácteos, enlatados etc., con esta compra mejorará su stock de  inventarios, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Alexander is 31 years old. He lives in a metropolitan municipality of Barranquilla with his partner and his children ages 4 and 7 years old. He has a store there where he sells snacks, groceries, vegetables, meat, etc. His experience dates back five years. In 2012 he worked as an employee in a store and acquired the experience that propelled him to start up his own independent business.

Alexander offers his products in the store for cash and also offers some credits. He works every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. His customers are his neighbors from the area who buy from him the basic staple goods that are consumed daily based on their detailed availability.

He is currently requesting a loan - his first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo - that he will use to buy drinks, rice, meat, dairy, canned food, etc. With this purchase he will improve his stock of inventory, thus making a good investment from his loan.

loans.use: To buy drinks, rice, meat, dairy, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old and married with six children. With six children in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care  and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo de 58 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a procesar leche, tiene seis hijos que ya han formado sus propios hogares.

 
Desde joven, Raimundo aprendió a cultivar maíz y frijol gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, además actualmente realiza trabajos de ganadería, todo esto lo hace de lunes a domingo, sin día de descanso ya que es un hombre que le gusta el trabajo y mantenerse ocupado.

Raimundo utilizará el crédito para comprar una vaca y para comprar materiales para reparar su vivienda.

Su sueño es seguir con su negocio y reparar poco a poco su vivienda para sentirse mas seguro.
texts.en:
Raimundo is 58 years old and studied through the 3rd grade.  He is married and his wife works raising hogs and processing milk.  They have six children who have all begun their own families.  

From the time he was young, Raimundo learned to grow corn and beans thanks to the teachings of his father.  Currently he also raises livestock.  He does all of this work from Monday to Sunday, without a day of rest, since he is a man who likes to work and to be occupied.  

Raimundo will use his loan to buy a cow and to purchase materials for repairing his home.

His dream is to continue with his business and to repair his home little by little in order to feel more safe.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to purchase materials for repairing his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloths to sew garments and then sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Rubina's husband in purchasing initial stock of fresh and seasonal vegetables to setup green grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps SHAHNAZ's husband to purchase a new welding plant for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Sarwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sarwan. 

Sarwan lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Sarwan lives there with his wife and his three children (two daughters and one son). 

Sarwan owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He feels happy that he joined Ruma because for him, Ruma’s services are the best. 

He learnt a lot about how to manage his business from Ruma, as well as how to manage his income and savings. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Sarwan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, especially on weekends, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. As seen in the photo, 

Sarwan is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Isuwa

texts.en:
Isuwa is a Babban Gona farmer from Pegi Village. Isuwa joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isuwa will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds.

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Isuwa would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various mobile accessories and extra recharge credit for husband's mobile shop.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan to Titin a mother of five and safe drinking water entrepreneur. She repaid her previous loan before it was due. She applies for a new loan to provide inventory to her sub-agents so she can provide water filters in a larger area. 
 
Titin lives in Cikarang, which is a suburban area of the greater Jakarta agglomeration of over 28 million people. In this area nobody has potable water from their taps. Many people use well water which is often very dirty. To get safe drinking water people have to buy water which is very expensive. 

That is why Titin started to sell Nazava Water Filters and so far with great success. “Kiva loans are a key factor for the success of my business”, says Titin

The Kiva loan allows Titin to save on shipping costs, enables her to expand more quickly and will therefore provide more people with safe and affordable drinking water.   With this loan she can buy around 200 drinking water filters and 20 filters that can turn dirty water in to clear water. Titin will then sell this filters to her consumers, providing safe drinking water to 1000 people and clear water for washing purposes to 100 people.

loans.use: to purchase water purifiers to sell to the sub-urban population of Cikarang

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 30 years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home, as she is a good house wife. Her husband provides services in painting work to buildings and shops as well. In this regard her husband was in need of some painting related items such as paints of different colours, brushes, distempers etc for increasing his work. 

So Nazia made contact to Brac Pakistan for a loan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan.
Nazia is so much thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paints of different colours, brushes, distempers etc for her husband's painting business

loans.name: Prajapati

texts.en:
46 years old Prajapati is a rural housewife who belongs to the Below Poverty Line category. She lives in the small village of Falakata in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. As this village is situated on the riverbank, vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the villagers. 

Prajapati has a vegetable cultivation farm. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband Bimal is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like eggplant, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers etc. on their land. Her husband sells the product to the traders from the nearest town who come to take vegetables from their farm. She wants to diversify her business for future development; they have decided to cultivate maize on a large scale, which is a profitable crop.

Prajapati and her husband want to expand their business by taking a loan from Kiva through BJS. She will use the present loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for maize cultivation. They expect a good return from their business by expanding their cultivation. 

Prajapati hopes the loan will help her to raise her standard of living and she is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To pay for farm supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 32-year-old housewife who is married to Bablu. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Alipurduar district. She and her husband studied up to grade 10, but she wishes to provide good education to their children; the children are in grade 4 and 7, respectively. 

Her husband runs a small restaurant shop in their locality and mainly sells fast foods like chow mein, eggrolls, kababs, pakoras, etc., but in the afternoon, he also sells food items like steamed rice, curry, dal, fish curry, etc., for lunch to generate additional income. Bablu runs this business with the assistance of Rina. Rina and her husband prepare varieties of delicious food items in their shop, which has a great demand in the locality. 

Now Rina needs to expand her business to satisfy the demand of their customers. Thus, Rina applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in their business. She will use the loan to buy different kinds of essential raw food items for their restaurant. Rina hopes this loan will give a boost to their business. 

Rina and her husband are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase necessary food items to expand the existing small restaurant business.

loans.name: Jabeda

texts.en:
Jabeda, age 49 years old is a married woman.  She is from Baganbari village in Falakata of Alipurduar district. She lives with her 61-year-old husband Aftar and two sons. Jabeda is illiterate and can sign her name only. Both of her sons run a moderate grocery shop in their locality. 

Her husband is inactive now; his age does not permit him to contribute to his family. Jabeda, being a hardworking lady, helps her family financially by running a grocery shop, after managing her household work, along with her sons.  She sells food items like spices, rice, pulses (lentils), sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits, etc. and daily essential goods. Now Jabeda wants to grow her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. Thus she is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop.

With the expansion of business Jabeda hopes to have a better income which will help her to develop the financial condition of her family. She wants to save the outcome profit for her children’s future and to renovate her grocery shop with a variety of items.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Namsanam Group

texts.en:
Ban understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Ban knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Ban purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Ban is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xaibuangern Group

texts.en: Phoumork is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Phoumork and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Phoumork and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phoumork and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phoumork and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en: Nov’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, plus save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, a Palestinian Refugee living in the North of Lebanon, is married and a father to 3 kids. He is 47 years old and has 26 years experience as a taxi driver.  In order to develop his work and cover the maintenance costs of his car, Mahmoud is asking for 1,799,994 Lebanese Pound for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. Since day one, he used to depend on himself to develop his project. He picks up teachers to their work on daily basis, in addition to delivering orders in Beirut and the airport. He is well known for his honesty and probity and has a very good reputation.

loans.use: to pay for his car maintenance

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 59 years old and married with three children. Two of his children are in senior high school and one is attending a post-secondary school.

Kofi believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. Selling more organic palm fruit will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and purchase materials to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Xeod Group

texts.en:
Padthana’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Treating drinking water requires cash and time. Padthana and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets.

Padthana is the leader of a group that is requesting a loan to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water. She and her group are excited that the filter is available on a payment plan which makes it much more affordable. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this time period, filter users such as Padthana’s family, will experience a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Somsanouk Group

texts.en:
Seevilai understands the difference filtered water can have on her family and for her loan group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

Seevilai is the leader of a group that is requesting a loan to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water. The water filter Seevilai will purchase will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water. Seevilai is excited that the filter can be purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years. She and group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Abaam, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 59 years old and married with four children, two of which are in senior high school. 

Johnson believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. Selling more organic palm fruit will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and purchase materials to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 47 years old and married with four children, two of which are in senior high school and the other two in primary school. 

Kwaku believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. Selling more organic palm fruit will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and purchase materials to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Paksa Group

texts.en:
Khan and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Khan and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khan and her group recognized the substantial financial savings purchase a water filter will have for their families.

Khan’s group is requesting a loan to purchase TerraClear water filter to have access to self drinking water. The filter they will purchase is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm mill, and she also grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 49 years old and married with three children. All of her children are attending school. 

Hannah is interested in organic oil palm farming, because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today, while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 77 years old and married with twelve children, most of whom are still attending school. 

Stephen believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. 

Selling more organic palm fruit to will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and purchase materials to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 55 years old, married, and has one child. To help her husband for family needs and to earn income, she engaged in a buy & sell business of coconuts. She buys coconuts and sells it to the community. She used her motorcycle for her buy and sell business. As part of motorcycle maintenance, the motorcycle needs spare parts for repair, so it can continue to carry and deliver coconuts. This is why she decided to take a loan.

In the future, Cecelia wants to save money from her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 61 years old and she lives and runs a farm with her family in Ddamashen village of Gegharkunik region.

Lida has had a specialty of nursing since she graduated from Sevan city’s medical college and for a long time she worked  as a nurse. Now she is busy only with farming and agriculture.

On her farm she has cows, calves, pigs, sheep and a lot of chickens. Since Lida’s husband is unemployed, he greatly helps his wife about their farm. Together they sell their farm products - milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese, curd, meat and eggs - at the city’s wholesale market

Lida mentions that the care of her farm and the cattle on it needs much time and attention, but land cultivation is also a very important and profitable occupation for her family. Her potatoes from her land she sells wholesale to re-sellers right from her house.

This loan she asks for is for potato production; particularly, she will buy diesel fuel, fertilizer and potato seedlings. She is thankful beforehand and hopes that in this season she will also manage to have a good harvest and sales of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Rosales

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosales works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosales is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing tools for his fishing business.

Rosales has been sustaining her business activities through his past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 57-year-old widow woman with four children. She lives in Salt. She has been sewing since childhood and took courses to improve her skills. She has started working to sewing clothes for family, friends, and neighbors to get income beside the pension of her husband.  Alia wanted to be productive and to provide the needs of her children she does not want to need anything from anybody. She is an ambitious woman who wants to improve the standards of living for her family; therefore she wants to develop her work and applying for a loan to buy what she needs from the supplies and fabrics and yarns to increase her products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Guliypa

texts.ru: Гулийпа, 43 года, замужем. У нее - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гулийпы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 5 овец. Гулийпа решила в этом году завершить строительство ее дома. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку досок, однако большую часть кредита она направит на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулийпа планирует и дальше вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Guliypa is 43 years old and married. She has a higher education. She raises animals as the main income for her family, having started 15 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, today Guliypa has four cows and five sheep. Guliypa has decided to finish building her house this year. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy boards, but she will direct the main part of the loan towards buying three cows to increase her herd. Guliypa plans to invest the profits from the loan in continuing to increase the number of her domestic livestock and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy boards to finish building her house and to buy three cows in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 61-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and three sons, and one of her sons has been doing his own business of meat for the past eight years.
