Her son is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Suriya's son wants to purchase animals for his meat business purposes, but due to financial constraints her son is unable to purchase these cattle.
Therefore Suriya has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business; this will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for the butcher shop

loans.name: Yoeurng

texts.en: Yoeurng, 55, living in Kandal province, is a widowed mother who has a child in school. She grows rice and feeds chicken for sale to earn money to support her family and has been doing it for about ten years. She could earn about 85,900KHR per day. In order to fulfill her dream of creating a new business, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy a cow for supporting her farming business. She hopes to earn more money and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to feed for sale

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet you one of Ruma’s agents, Abdullah. Abdullah lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Abdullah is happily married. Together with his wife they have one child. As his main source of income, Abdullah owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. He feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. His community sees Abdullah as a trusted and friendly mobile provider, as well as a kind & informative person. 

Right now, Abdullah has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities, called Mapan. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, for major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. Customers deposit change at agents like Abdullah, and their balance grows until they have enough for the purchase.
  
As a Mapan agent, Abdullah is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Abdullah will submit the order via SMS, and within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Abdullah believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products at better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Abdullah is shown standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed for helping community members save more money to purchase through Ruma's layaway product called Mapan.

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of four children, living in Battambang province, Saroun has been a cassava farmer for eight years. To earn more income, she works on other farms to get fees as well.

Due to lack of funds, she is now forming a group of three to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for the labor fee. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the labor fee.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng is a 35-year-old farmer whose wife is also a farmer. They have three children who are in primary school. Also, he has to support his parents who are over 70 years old and help him to feed sheep.

Cheng began to feed and sell sheep two years ago. The income from sheep is used to support the big family in a happy life. As to the bad economic environment, the business has not gone well in this year, and it could not afford them the necessities of life. In order to support the family, Cheng hunted for another job as a construction worker near the city.

Cheng requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred to buy sheep to earn enough money. This is the third time he has borrowed money from there. He hopes their lives becomes better and better in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sugiyono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Sugiyono. Sugiyono lives in Denpasar, the capital city of Bali, located about two hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Sugiyono owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn more about how to improve his business using technology. His community sees Sugiyono as a friendly person, that’s why it’s really easy for him to attract customers.
 
As the business grows, Sugiyono is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sugiyono improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Sugiyono’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to provide an e-commerce service for his community. As seen in the photo, Sugiyono is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's furniture work

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 43-years-old married woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. She is the mother for three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low income. Amneh works as a farmer in the family agricultural land where she plants olive trees.

Amneh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 
Amneh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm, to have more productivity and income for her family

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer from Bamiyayi Vilage. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Haruna would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yield.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona farmer from Bamiyayi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to start the construction of a bathroom and the installment of sewage pipes.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda que le da su esposo es como ha logrado salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Vilma, 57 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked sewing clothing for the past 20 years. Her sewing workshop is located in her home and she has many customers due to the quality with which she makes the clothing. With what she earns in her work, and with the help that her husband gives her, is how she has managed to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. and in this way be able to continue with her work that generates good earnings.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Maria Iris

texts.es:
La socia Maria Iris pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI.
La socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua sembrando  verduras como habas, zanahorias, cebollas entre otras para luego venderlas a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Iris is a member of the "Pro Mujer de Huayocari" communal bank. She continues to earn her living in farming. She has been working in this business for a long time; it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She continues to plant vegetables like broad beans, carrots, onions, and others, which she later sells to customers who request them. She would like to continue working in order to keep supporting her family.

Maria is requesting the loan to buy seeds and soil amendments. She feels grateful for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and soil amendments
